original: tshad mas ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'ongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde lta na yang 'ong bar rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mas ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'ongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de lta na yang 'ong bar rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the case that the past is not perceived because it is not perceived by a valid cognition.üîΩThe response to the objection that if it is cognized as coming, it follows that sound is impermanent is in the phrase it follows that.üîΩIf it is cognized as coming, it follows that sound is impermanent.üîΩThe response to the objection that if sound is not cognized as coming, it follows that sound is permanent is in the phrase it follows that.

original: gal te sgra dbang po'i yul du thag ring por rtogs pa rnams kyang 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra dbang po'i yul du thag ring por rtogs pa rnams kyang 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If sound is not cognized as coming, it follows that sound is permanent.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o yul rgyang ring po ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o yul rgyang ring po ni sgra'o //
translated: The commentary on this is ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on. The object is sound that is distant.

original: phrad pa de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAt the time of contact, form and so on‚Äù is the same.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni lus la gnas pa rnams dang phrad pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni lus la gnas pa rnams dang phrad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of contact with those that are located in the body.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSince that is so‚Äù means because of that.

original: 'on te mi slu ba med @75b pa'i phyir na 'das pa la sogs pa nyid yod pa nyid ma yin no snyam du dogs na mi slu pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi slu ba med @75b pa'i phyir na 'das pa la sogs pa nyid yod pa nyid ma yin no snyam du dogs na mi slu pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you suspect that the past and so on do not exist because they are not deceptive, then there is ‚ÄúDeceptive‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po las rtogs pa yod pa yin gyi sgra las rtogs pa ni ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po las rtogs pa yod pa yin gyi sgra las rtogs pa ni ma yin snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: You suspect that they exist through the sense faculties and not through sound, so the commentary anticipates this with ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa yang dbang pos rtogs par bya ba nyid kyis yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsod pa rjes su brjod nas lan 'debs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba ni skra shad la sogs pa yang dbang pos rtogs par bya ba nyid kyis yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: After stating the objection, the response is ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on. The meaning is that even such things as floating hairs would become existent because they are cognized by the sense faculties.

original: gal te dbang po nyams pa'i phyir sbrang bu la sogs pa yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po nyams pa'i phyir sbrang bu la sogs pa yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If flies, etc. do not exist because the sense-faculties are impaired,

original: de'i tshe nyams pa de tshad ma gang gis nges /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyams pa de tshad ma gang gis nges /
translated: then by what valid cognition is that impairment ascertained?üîΩIf it is not so, then the cognition of the impairment of the sense-faculties is the non-existence of flies, etc.

original: gal te de lta ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir na dbang po rnams nyams pa'i rtogs pa la ni sbrang bu la sogs pa med pa yin na de ltar 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir na dbang po rnams nyams pa'i rtogs pa la ni sbrang bu la sogs pa med pa yin na de ltar 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan yin no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIf that is so, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dbang po las rtogs pas yod pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dbang po las rtogs pas yod pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that existence is realized through the sense-faculties, therefore, etc.

original: de dngos gcig phyir zhes bya ba de'i don nye bar sdud pa ni sgra dang dbang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dngos gcig phyir zhes bya ba de'i don nye bar sdud pa ni sgra dang dbang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of that meaning is ‚Äúsound and the sense-faculty, etc.

original: 'di phyir yang zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'i tshul las so //
analyzed: 'di phyir yang zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'i tshul las so //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúAlso, because of this‚Äù is from the method of explanation.

original: gsal ba'i ngo tha dad du ste phan tshun ldog par ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo tha dad du ste phan tshun ldog par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDistinctly‚Äù means mutually exclusive.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kyang khas blangs pa nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis kyang khas blangs pa nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù indicates that the other also accepts that.

original: grub pa ste rang gi rgyu la skyes pa na de'i tshe 'di rigs ldan nyid kyi rigs ni med do //
analyzed: grub pa ste rang gi rgyu la skyes pa na de'i tshe 'di rigs ldan nyid kyi rigs ni med do //
translated: When it is established, i.e., when it has arisen from its cause, then at that time, it does not have the nature of a reason.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang phyir te gzhan la brten no //
analyzed: gang phyir te gzhan la brten no //
translated: Because it is dependent on another.

original: de lta ma yin na ni gzhan la brten med de gzhan dang ma 'dres pa 'am gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni gzhan la brten med de gzhan dang ma 'dres pa 'am gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be dependent on another, because it would not be mixed with another or it would not rely on another.

original: khra bo la sogs pa la ni ser skya la sogs pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa la ni ser skya la sogs pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: In a multicolored object, one does not see a white color, etc.

original: tha dad pa gzhan la brten pa yang 'bras bu nyid yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan la brten pa yang 'bras bu nyid yin la /
translated: The dependence on another that is different is the effect itself.

original: de na rgyu la sogs pa la phan tshun yod pa ma yin na gang las 'bras bu nyid kyi ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: de na rgyu la sogs pa la phan tshun yod pa ma yin na gang las 'bras bu nyid kyi ltos par 'gyur /
translated: If cause, etc., do not exist in mutual dependence, then how could the effect itself be dependent?

original: rang gi rgyu la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the effect itself exists in dependence on its cause,

original: de lta na yang grub pa ni ltos pa ma yin te /üîΩgzhan la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang grub pa ni ltos pa ma yin te / gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: then even so, the established does not depend,üîΩbecause it is dependent on another.

original: grub phyir zhes bya ba ste skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub phyir zhes bya ba ste skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The established does not depend on another, because it is established, i.e., because it has already arisen.

original: 'bras bu yang gzhan la rag las pa ma yin te des na ltos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang gzhan la rag las pa ma yin te des na ltos pa med pa yin no //
translated: Nor is the effect dependent on something else, so it is not dependent.

original: ma grub pa na bskyed par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi ltos pa ni ma yin te rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa na bskyed par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi ltos pa ni ma yin te rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not established, it is merely what is to be produced, but it is not dependent, because it does not exist itself.

original: ser skya la sogs pa 'bras bu ma yin pa ni grub pa'am ma grub pa la ltos pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ser skya la sogs pa 'bras bu ma yin pa ni grub pa'am ma grub pa la ltos pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the non-effect of Kapila, etc. dependent on what is established or not established,üîΩbecause even in dependence on that, it is accepted as the effect.

original: de la ltos nas kyang 'bras bu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /üîΩ'bras @76a * //
analyzed: de la ltos nas kyang 'bras bu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni / 'bras @76a * //
translated: The response to that is:

original: min ji ltar zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: min ji ltar zhes gsungs te /
translated: How could the non-effect be an effect?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang ngo //
translated: In both cases,üîΩwhat?

original: ci zhig ces bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it is just that.

original: gal te 'di de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'di de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not understood that this is the effect of that in connection with its cause,

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu ma yin yang de nyid 'di yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu ma yin yang de nyid 'di yin no zhe na /
translated: then even the non-effect is just that.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: rang gi rgyu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu zhes gsungs so //
translated: Its own cause.

original: rgyu dang 'brel bar byed pa ni rtogs pa 'ba' zhig gis yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel bar byed pa ni rtogs pa 'ba' zhig gis yin gyi /
translated: The connection with the cause is only by way of the cognition,

original: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: not by way of perception,

original: de las bzlog par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opposite is perceived.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan yin yang gsal ba'i rang bzhin des 'brel pa med par grub bo //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin las gzhan yin yang gsal ba'i rang bzhin des 'brel pa med par grub bo //
translated: Even though it is different from the nature of manifestation, it is established that it is not connected with the nature of manifestation.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa dang cig shos kyi rnam par rtog pa mi srid pa de'i phyir rigs ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa dang cig shos kyi rnam par rtog pa mi srid pa de'i phyir rigs ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: Since the conceptions of difference and non-difference are impossible, therefore the universal is indeed essenceless.

original: gang zhig tha dad pa dang gzhan du med pa de ni dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad pa dang gzhan du med pa de ni dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is not different and not other is not a thing.

original: gal te zhes bya ba rnam par 'brel ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba rnam par 'brel ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The connection with ‚Äúif‚Äù is with ‚Äúendowed with the universal.‚Äù

original: khas blangs pa dang po zlog par byed pa ni de re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang po zlog par byed pa ni de re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The reversal of the first position is ‚Äúthat is not so.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa ni /üîΩgzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni / gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
translated: The second isüîΩ‚ÄúIf it were different, it would not be connected.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba rnam par 'brel pa na bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba rnam par 'brel pa na bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The connection is reversed.

original: bshad pa mdzad pa yang gal te tha dad grub ce na zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu min ji ltar yang /
analyzed: bshad pa mdzad pa yang gal te tha dad grub ce na zhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu min ji ltar yang /
translated: The explanation is also as follows: If it is established as different, then how could it be the effect?

original: ci zhig bya ba ci zhes bya ba dang sbyar nas tha dad pa'i phyogs la ltos nas 'chad pa yin na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya ba ci zhes bya ba dang sbyar nas tha dad pa'i phyogs la ltos nas 'chad pa yin na /
translated: If it is explained in dependence on the position of difference, then what is to be done?

original: gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na de 'brel med //
translated: If it were different, it would be unrelated.

original: ces bya ba 'di don gang zhig gsal ba'i ngo bo tha dad du gal te grub na zhes bya ba 'di gsal ba'i yul can nyid du 'chad pa ni de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di don gang zhig gsal ba'i ngo bo tha dad du gal te grub na zhes bya ba 'di gsal ba'i yul can nyid du 'chad pa ni de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the nature of manifestation were established as different, then this would be explained as the subject of manifestation, just as variegated and so on.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang ltos ba dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang ltos ba dang bcas pa nyid du rtogs pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that both are understood to have dependence is:

original: 'di ni de dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is similar to that.

original: 'bras bu min ji ltar yang ci zhig bya ba 'di yang gsal ba'i yul can du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu min ji ltar yang ci zhig bya ba 'di yang gsal ba'i yul can du brjod pa ni /
translated: How could it be the effect? What is to be done? This is also stated as the subject of manifestation.

original: shes ldan ci ldog pa la ma yin nam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes ldan ci ldog pa la ma yin nam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Wise one, is it not the opposite?

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa gsal ba'i rang bzhin las rigs gzhan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa gsal ba'i rang bzhin las rigs gzhan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is a different type from the nature of the manifestation, which is not the effect,

original: gsal ba las gzhan dang de las spyi tha dad yin zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: gsal ba las gzhan dang de las spyi tha dad yin zhes gsungs te ;
translated: then it is said that it is different from the manifestation and different from the universal.

original: spyi gzhan nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: spyi gzhan nyid yin na'o //
translated: If the universal were different,

original: gsal ba las gsal ba gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba las gsal ba gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro // de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: ‚Äúfrom the manifestation, different from the manifestation‚Äù means that it is not related.üîΩThis is clarified:

original: 'brel pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúwithout relation.‚Äù

original: 'o na ni ba lang nyid gsal ba la sogs pa'i spyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni ba lang nyid gsal ba la sogs pa'i spyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: But the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc.,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du dngos po med pas nye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du dngos po med pas nye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.üîΩIf it were, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.üîΩ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚Äù

original: @76b gal te 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva yang 'gyur ro zhes 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: @76b gal te 'gyur na ni ri bong gi rva yang 'gyur ro zhes 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If you say that it is, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.

original: med par rigs su thal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med par rigs su thal mi 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you say that it is, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.üîΩ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that it is, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.üîΩ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that it is, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.üîΩ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that it is, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.üîΩ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that it is, then the horn of a rabbit would be, too.

original: ci'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang khra bo la sogs pa de gnyis la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang khra bo la sogs pa de gnyis la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBut the universal of cow would not be a universal of the manifestation, etc., because it is not related, like the horn of a rabbit, because it does not exist.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that it is, then the

original: dngos po med pa yang spyir 'gyur ro zhes de skad brjod pa ste /üîΩci yang gi gsal ba la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang spyir 'gyur ro zhes de skad brjod pa ste / ci yang gi gsal ba la ltos nas sam /
translated: This is what you say.

original: gsal ba gzhan la ltos nas rang gi gsal ba la ltos nas ni skyon med do zhes gsungs pa ni ri bong gi rva ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la ltos nas rang gi gsal ba la ltos nas ni skyon med do zhes gsungs pa ni ri bong gi rva ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But there is no fault in saying that the universal is dependent on the particular, or that the particular is dependent on the universal, or that the particular is dependent on another particular, or that the universal is dependent on another universal.üîΩThe expression ‚Äúthe horn of a rabbit‚Äù is just an example.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs second objection is as follows:

original: gzhan gyi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs gnyis pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /üîΩbrjod pa ni ci dngos por smra ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyogs gnyis pa'i dogs pa bsu nas / brjod pa ni ci dngos por smra ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is this:

original: gzhan dag ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa ni /
translated: The reason why the particular is not different is

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not dependent on another.

original: de ni ba lang nyid de de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ba lang nyid de de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response to this is ‚ÄúIf that is so, then . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam par rtog pas yongs su brgyud pa'i ba lang nyid de'i spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam par rtog pas yongs su brgyud pa'i ba lang nyid de'i spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin zhe na /
translated: The proponent of the thesis responds, ‚ÄúWell then, how is it that the nature of the universal is the cow that is conceived by conceptualization?‚Äù

original: bshad pa ba lang ni ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bshad pa ba lang ni ltos pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The reply is: The cow is related by the characteristic of dependence.

original: des ni dngos po med bzhin du skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni dngos po med bzhin du skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the error does not occur in the absence of an entity.

original: ji ltar 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel zhe na /
translated: How is it related?

original: gtan tshigs gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Two reasons are stated:

original: brten nas zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa la brten nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence‚Äù means in dependence on the variegated, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù means in the variegated, etc.

original: ci ste yang rang bzhin gang zhig rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin yang sla ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang rang bzhin gang zhig rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin de ni tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa yin yang sla ste /
translated: But if the nature that appears in thought is either different or non-different,

original: khra bo la sogs pa rnams la yod pa nyid yin te de lta ma yin na rnam pa de lta bu'i blong ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa rnams la yod pa nyid yin te de lta ma yin na rnam pa de lta bu'i blong ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs nas bshad pa /
translated: it is still present in the variegated, etc., otherwise, how could there be a cognition of that kind?

original: spyi de'i rang bzhin ni khra bo la sogs pa de rnams la 'brel pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: spyi de'i rang bzhin ni khra bo la sogs pa de rnams la 'brel pa tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The reply is: The nature of that universal is not present in the variegated, etc., as a different or non-different entity.

original: tha mi dad par yang ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de'i rang bzhin med kyang rang bzhin dang ldan pa de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad par yang ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de'i rang bzhin med kyang rang bzhin dang ldan pa de ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is not non-different, but even though it is neither different nor non-different, it is not that it has no nature.

original: gang gi phyir rigs gsal ba'i rang bzhin las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ngo bo med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs gsal ba'i rang bzhin las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir ngo bo med pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not to be described as either the same or different from the nature of the manifestation of the potential, therefore it is without entityness.

original: gal te ngo bo med pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po la nye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo med pa yin na de'i tshe dngos po la nye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is without entityness, then since it is not related to an entity,

original: khra bo la sogs pa da dang 'brel pa 'dod pa tsam las byung bas rtogs pa tsam gyis bkod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa da dang 'brel pa 'dod pa tsam las byung bas rtogs pa tsam gyis bkod par 'gyur la /
translated: it would be posited by mere conceptualization, arising from the mere wish to relate it to variegated things and so on.üîΩIn that case, it would be related to the horns of a rabbit.

original: de lta na yang ri bong gi rva dang yang 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas khyad par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang ri bong gi rva dang yang 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas khyad par brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this qualm, the distinction is stated:

original: @77a * // ngo bo la brten na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @77a * // ngo bo la brten na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were based on an entity.

original: byi ba dang phyugs la sogs pa yang khra bo mthong nas khu yu mthong ba na de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes de nyid du mngon par rlom gyi /
analyzed: byi ba dang phyugs la sogs pa yang khra bo mthong nas khu yu mthong ba na de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes de nyid du mngon par rlom gyi /
translated: Even mice, cattle, etc., when they see a variegated object, and then see a peacock, think ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù and identify it.

original: ngang pa la sogs pa na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngang pa la sogs pa na ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not think ‚Äúit is like a peacock.‚Äù

original: ri bong gi rva ni don mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nye bar bstan pa yang ma yin no //üîΩdon mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nye bar bkod pa'i rigs de nyid brda yod na sgra rnams kyis brjod pa yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir don mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas bya ba'i yul can gyi sgra rnams brgyud nas don gyi yul can du gyur pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni rigs de'i khyad par du gyur pa'i gsal ba gang yin de la 'jug don
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni don mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nye bar bstan pa yang ma yin no // don mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas nye bar bkod pa'i rigs de nyid brda yod na sgra rnams kyis brjod pa yin te / de nyid kyi phyir don mthong ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas bya ba'i yul can gyi sgra rnams brgyud nas don gyi yul can du gyur pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni rigs de'i khyad par du gyur pa'i gsal ba gang yin de la 'jug don
translated: The horn of a rabbit is not indicated by a conceptual thought that arises from seeing an object.üîΩWhen there is a convention, words express that very type that is indicated by a conceptual thought that arises from seeing an object.üîΩTherefore, it is said that words, which have as their domain the conceptual thought that arises from seeing an object, indirectly have an object as their domain.

original: te / dgos pa gang dag las yod pa'i sgra de rnams kyis rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: te / dgos pa gang dag las yod pa'i sgra de rnams kyis rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words are applied to that particular instance of the type, because that is the purpose for which the words exist.

original: rtogs pa yang yul mtshungs pa'i sgra rnams ci ltar gsal ba'i yul can du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang yul mtshungs pa'i sgra rnams ci ltar gsal ba'i yul can du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how can the cognition have the same object as the word, since it is a subject that is clear?

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa yang lhag par zhen pas de'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa yang lhag par zhen pas de'i yul can yin te /
translated: Because the cognition also has that as its object, since it is a subsequent adherence to it.

original: des na rtogs pa dang yul mtshungs pa yin yang gsal ba'i yul can kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa dang yul mtshungs pa yin yang gsal ba'i yul can kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, although the cognition has the same object as the word, it is only a subject that is clear.

original: kha cig ni ngo bo phan tshun khyad par can du gyur la /
analyzed: kha cig ni ngo bo phan tshun khyad par can du gyur la /
translated: Some say that the nature of the word is mutually distinguished,

original: brgyud nas brten nas rtag pa zhes bya ba bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyud nas brten nas rtag pa zhes bya ba bkod pa yin no //
translated: and that the word is posited as permanent by way of a continuum.

original: khyad par yang yin la rigs kyang yin la ste rnam par bcad pas so //
analyzed: khyad par yang yin la rigs kyang yin la ste rnam par bcad pas so //
translated: It is distinguished and also a type, by way of exclusion.

original: de la 'jug pa ni rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa'i sgra rnams kyis zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni rtogs par byed pa gang yin pa'i sgra rnams kyis zhes 'chad do //
translated: The engagement with that is by the words that cause the cognition.

original: gal te ngo bo med pa yin na ni ci ltar ngo bo dang ldan pa lta bur rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo med pa yin na ni ci ltar ngo bo dang ldan pa lta bur rtogs she na /
translated: If it has no nature, how can it be cognized as if it has a nature?

original: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Nevertheless, he says.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pas yongs su bsgyur ba'i rigs la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pas yongs su bsgyur ba'i rigs la'o //
translated: Here means in the type that is transformed by the cognition.

original: gal te gzhan rtogs pas gzhan la ci lar 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan rtogs pas gzhan la ci lar 'jug snyam na /
translated: If you think that if one is realized, how can the other be engaged?

original: de las skyes pa de nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it arises from that.‚Äù

original: rigs de rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i rigs rtogs par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: rigs de rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i rigs rtogs par 'gyur na'o //
translated: If the lineage is realized, means if the lineage endowed with the nature is realized.

original: gang gi phyir de rtogs na khyad par rnams la 'jug pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rtogs na khyad par rnams la 'jug pa des na'o //
translated: Because of that realization, one engages in the distinctions.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgyur ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgyur ba nyid la'o //
translated: It is in the transformation of that very thing by conceptualization.

original: rnam par gcad par bya ba brjod pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcad par bya ba brjod pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe other‚Äù is the object of exclusion.

original: rigs ngo bo'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ngo bo'i rnam pa dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ngo bo mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the lineage has the aspect of the nature, means because the nature is seen.

original: gsal ba dang lhan cig gcig tu lhag par zhen pa ga las yin /
analyzed: gsal ba dang lhan cig gcig tu lhag par zhen pa ga las yin /
translated: How can there be the superimposition of identity with the manifestation?

original: ma yin pa nyid de gcig nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid de gcig nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not so, because identity is not seen.

original: gal te gcig nyid bzhin du ngo bo yang ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gcig nyid bzhin du ngo bo yang ma mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not so, is not the nature also not seen, just as identity is?

original: des @77b na ji ltar ngo bo'i rnam pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: des @77b na ji ltar ngo bo'i rnam pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be the form of the entity?

original: ngo bo nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe entity itself.‚Äù

original: 'o na gcig nyid kyang ci ste ma mthong zhe na ma mthong bar zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'o na gcig nyid kyang ci ste ma mthong zhe na ma mthong bar zhes smras so //
translated: Well then, why is the very one not seen? He says, ‚ÄúNot seen.‚Äù

original: gsal ba dang snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba dang snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the form of the manifestation and the form of the appearance are different.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni ma mthong yang 'di ni 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni ma mthong yang 'di ni 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The conclusion is that even though it is not seen, it is tenable to say, ‚ÄúThis is so.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that regard.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rigs de la ngo bor snang ba yang ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rigs de la ngo bor snang ba yang ste /
translated: In that class of conceptualization that is the appearance, the appearance as the entity is also.

original: mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa nyid dam /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa nyid dam /
translated: The form of the nature that is not clear,

original: don la de nyid du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: don la de nyid du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba /
translated: or the apprehension of that very thing as the object,

original: gsal ba nyid dang lhan cig nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid dang lhan cig nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: is the apprehension as the very clarity and as the very simultaneity.

original: gal te de'i rang bzhin ma grub na 'di 'dra ba'i 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rang bzhin ma grub na 'di 'dra ba'i 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If its nature is not established, how can there be such a mistake?

original: dus thog ma yod pa ma yin pa can gyi mthong ba gang yin pa de goms pa sprul pa'o //
analyzed: dus thog ma yod pa ma yin pa can gyi mthong ba gang yin pa de goms pa sprul pa'o //
translated: The seeing that has no beginning in time is the cultivation of the emanation.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa mthong ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa mthong ba nyid kyis so //
translated: By seeing reality itself means by seeing non-difference.

original: de'i ngo bor ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor ni tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Its nature is the nature of non-difference.

original: 'o na de ci ltar 'gyur snyam na 'khrul pa gcig nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na de ci ltar 'gyur snyam na 'khrul pa gcig nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is that? It is said: ‚Äúfrom one error.‚Äù

original: don de nyid du 'dzin pa bya ba bshad nas lhag ma 'chad pa ni mi gsal bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don de nyid du 'dzin pa bya ba bshad nas lhag ma 'chad pa ni mi gsal bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the action of apprehending that very object, the remainder is explained as ‚Äúunclear.‚Äù

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni mi gsal bar snang ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni mi gsal bar snang ba la yang ngo //
translated: Here also means even in the appearance of the unclear.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is so, therefore.

original: de'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du mi gsal ba dag gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gcig nyid du mi gsal ba dag gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is the nature of the unclear single entity.

original: de ltar spyir dngos por 'gyur ba gsal nas rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la don gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis spyir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyir dngos por 'gyur ba gsal nas rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la don gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis spyir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Thus, having clarified the general entity, the nature of the object is established in general in the aspect of conceptual thought.

original: da ni gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: da ni gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: Now, the nature of the exclusion from others is stated.

original: brjod pa'i rang bzhin pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rang bzhin pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of expression is stated with ‚Äúor else.‚Äù

original: gzhan rigs mi mthun pa rnams la rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan rigs mi mthun pa rnams la rtogs pa ste /
translated: The definition of ‚Äúother‚Äù is that which is realized as being different from that.

original: ldog par byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid gang la yod par gzhan ldog par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de nyid spyi yin la /
analyzed: ldog par byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid gang la yod par gzhan ldog par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de nyid spyi yin la /
translated: That entity which has the nature of being the opposite of other is itself the universal.

original: sgra yang de'i mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra yang de'i mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: And the word is the final basis of that.

original: de spyi tha dad par smra ba bzhin du bum pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de spyi tha dad par smra ba bzhin du bum pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of a pot‚Äù is not the same as ‚Äúthe existence of a universal.‚Äù

original: 'di bzhi mthun pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di bzhi mthun pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: This is not the same as the fourfold concordance.

original: de la ngo bo yang cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo yang cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the nature of the universal does not exist in the slightest,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of an uncommon nature.

original: gal te gzhan las ldog pa yang gzhan las log pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las ldog pa yang gzhan las log pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the opposite of other is not the nature of the opposite of other,üîΩhow can it be natureless?

original: ji ltar ngo bo med snyam na gzhan la ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar ngo bo med snyam na gzhan la ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: The opposite of other is said to be the definition of the opposite of other.

original: rang bzhin zhes lta ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes lta ba ni /
translated: The view of ‚Äúnature‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: is uncommon.

original: gal te lta na yin mod /
analyzed: gal te lta na yin mod /
translated: If it is seen, it is indeed so.

original: de lta na yang de ni sgras shes par byed pa ma yin te /üîΩdes @78a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni sgras shes par byed pa ma yin te / des @78a * //
translated: But it is not known by the word.

original: na de brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
analyzed: na de brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
translated: What is the use of investigating it?

original: rigs mi mthun pa de las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa de las zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word is not related to that.

original: rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa gang yin pa de yang 'jug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa gang yin pa de yang 'jug pa med pa ste /
translated: That which is not related to that is also not engaged.

original: sgrub pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is not established at all.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that it does not have an uncommon nature.

original: 'jug par yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub par yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jug par yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub par yang ngo //
translated: Also means also engaged, also established.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni khyer te mi 'ong ba bkag pa las so //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni khyer te mi 'ong ba bkag pa las so //
translated: Thus means because of the negation of the non-carrying.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni sgra'i byed pa med par ro //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni sgra'i byed pa med par ro //
translated: By itself means without the activity of the word.

original: khyer nas 'ong ba ni khyer nas 'ong bar ro //
analyzed: khyer nas 'ong ba ni khyer nas 'ong bar ro //
translated: Carrying means carrying.

original: bum pa ma yin pa de 'gog pa ni bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa ma yin pa de 'gog pa ni bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The negation of that which is not a pot is a pot.

original: dgag pa la ni gzhan log pa'i mtshan nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i spyod yul du'o //
analyzed: dgag pa la ni gzhan log pa'i mtshan nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i spyod yul du'o //
translated: The negation is in the characteristic of the exclusion of the other, in the sphere of understanding.

original: de yang ni khyer nas 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ni khyer nas 'ong ba'o //
translated: and that is what is brought.

original: bum pa ma yin pa de 'gog pa ni bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa ma yin pa de 'gog pa ni bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The negation of non-pot is called pot.

original: dgag pa la ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: dgag pa la ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: In the negation means in the definition of the exclusion of other.

original: gal te ba lang ma yin the tshom za ba na ba lang ma yin par thal ba yin pas /
analyzed: gal te ba lang ma yin the tshom za ba na ba lang ma yin par thal ba yin pas /
translated: If there is doubt about non-cow, then it follows that it is non-cow.

original: der pa lang zhes bya ba ba lang ma yin pa las ldog par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: der pa lang zhes bya ba ba lang ma yin pa las ldog par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, cow is made to exclude non-cow.

original: gzhan dag tu ni dang po nyid ba lang zhes sbyar ba na /
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni dang po nyid ba lang zhes sbyar ba na /
translated: But in other cases, when cow is used from the beginning,üîΩit is understood to have the nature of establishing cow-ness.

original: ba lang nyid sgrub pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: ba lang nyid sgrub pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: To anticipate this doubt, he says:

original: gal te sgra dang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sgra dang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the first word is...

original: dag la ni bya ba'i tshig gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: dag la ni bya ba'i tshig gtso bo yin te /
translated: In those, the verbal expression is primary,

original: las su bya ba nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las su bya ba nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it shows what is to be done. This is said, but that is not so.

original: gzhan min par ni len par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan min par ni len par mi byed pa'o //
translated: It does not take the other as not being itself.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni len par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni len par mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to not taking up.

original: 'gog pa ni khyer la shog cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni khyer la shog cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúStop‚Äù means ‚Äúbring it here.‚Äù

original: 'dir thal ba yin zhes bya ba nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir thal ba yin zhes bya ba nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúconsequence‚Äù is stated.

original: de la thal ba gzhan ci yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la thal ba gzhan ci yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: What other consequence is there besides that?

original: de ni thal ba la'o//
analyzed: de ni thal ba la'o//
translated: That is a consequence.

original: khyer nas mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i khyer nas 'ong ba dang po smos pa na /
analyzed: khyer nas mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i khyer nas 'ong ba dang po smos pa na /
translated: When bringing it here is stated first,

original: de ni ba lang ma yin pa yang thal ba ba glang zhes sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni ba lang ma yin pa yang thal ba ba glang zhes sbyar ba yin no //
translated: it is applied as ‚Äúthe consequence of a cow is not a cow.‚Äù

original: des na yang nag po ma yin pa thal ba nag po zhes sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: des na yang nag po ma yin pa thal ba nag po zhes sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the consequence of not being black is applied as ‚Äúthe consequence of being black.‚Äù

original: des na gzhan sel ba kho na sgra'i don yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩma yin pa dgag pa kho na yin par med pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba kho na sgra'i don yin zhes bya ba'i don to // ma yin pa dgag pa kho na yin par med pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the meaning of a word is only an other-exclusion.

original: de las gzhan pa'i don ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i don ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is only an internal negation, not a nonimplicative negation, because the meaning of that is the absence of that.

original: yod pa yang spyi la brjod pa'i skyon bzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa yang spyi la brjod pa'i skyon bzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The existence of a universal is also not tenable, because the four errors of sameness and so on would ensue.

original: ma yin pa yang sgrub pa kho na yin no zhes rtsod pa brjod pa ni gal te de bkag pa ni zhes bya ba de rigs mi mthun pa de'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa yang sgrub pa kho na yin no zhes rtsod pa brjod pa ni gal te de bkag pa ni zhes bya ba de rigs mi mthun pa de'o //
translated: The objection is stated: ‚ÄúIf the negation of that is the nature of the negation, then the negation is only an affirmation.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni thun mong ma @78b yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni thun mong ma @78b yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The other is the uncommon nature.

translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no object different from the subject, it is not different from that‚Äù is not a proof. This is what is said.

original: yul can gyi gong bu las tha dad pa snang ba yin nam ma yin /üîΩsnang ba ma yin pa @80a * //
analyzed: yul can gyi gong bu las tha dad pa snang ba yin nam ma yin / snang ba ma yin pa @80a * //
translated: Is the appearance different from the mass of the subject or not?üîΩIt is not an appearance.

original: la brjod pa ni tha dad pa'i mi snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la brjod pa ni tha dad pa'i mi snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about what is not an appearance is ‚Äúthe nonappearance of the different . . .‚Äù

original: snang ba la brjod pa ni tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba la brjod pa ni tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance is expressed as ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy what‚Äù is

original: ji ltar tha mi dad par myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tha mi dad par myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: how it is experienced as undifferentiated.

original: gang gis yod par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis yod par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what‚Äù is ‚Äúin another way.‚Äù

original: des na de nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is ‚Äúby that.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni rang gi gsal ba las so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba ni rang gi gsal ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom something‚Äù is from its own manifestation.

original: 'di ni spyi gzhan khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi gzhan khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement accepting another universal.

original: da ni de'ang med do zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de'ang med do zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to say that it does not exist, he says,

original: spyi gzhan pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi gzhan pas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven by another universal.‚Äù

original: lan ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚Äúeven horns of a rabbit, etc.‚ÄùüîΩSince they are ultimately not different, they are not things.

original: de dag don dam par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te de dag gi zhes bya ba ste /üîΩri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag don dam par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te de dag gi zhes bya ba ste / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The response to the qualm is ‚ÄúIf they are,‚Äù etc.üîΩThe horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the text is ‚Äúhorns of a rabbit,‚Äù etc.

original: lan ni 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste mi la'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste mi la'o //
translated: The answer to that is ‚ÄúHere too,‚Äù that is, in the case of a human being.

original: brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid ston pa ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid ston pa ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúhere too‚Äù shows that the same is true of the case of a universal.üîΩSince a universal is not asserted to be different from another universal, therefore,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar spyi tha dad par gzhan las spyi tha dad par mi 'dod pa des na zhes bya ba ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar spyi tha dad par gzhan las spyi tha dad par mi 'dod pa des na zhes bya ba ni spyi yin te /
translated: ‚Äúit is not different from that,‚Äù that is, from the particular.

original: de ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: de ni de'i phyir gyi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: des rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: des rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the author of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: ci bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci bshad ce na /
translated: What is explained?

original: spyi ni spyi gzhan las tha dad par brjod pa min pa nyid do //
analyzed: spyi ni spyi gzhan las tha dad par brjod pa min pa nyid do //
translated: A universal is not said to be different from another universal.

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi rnams tha dad ce na /üîΩnyer len no //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi rnams tha dad ce na / nyer len no //
translated: But how are universals different?üîΩThey are different in virtue of their substrates.

original: 'o na gzhan las gzhan du nyer btags phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan las gzhan du nyer btags phyir ro //
translated: But how are they designated as different from one another?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the introduction to the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: de lta yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not‚Äù means that it is not the case that it is not an object of expression.

original: 'on kyang brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Rather, it is an object of expression.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause,‚Äù he says.

original: da ltar ba ni ma zad de 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa'i don la 'ong ngo //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni ma zad de 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa'i don la 'ong ngo //
translated: The present does not perish, but it is the object of the past and the future.

original: ci ste de la spyi yod pa des na de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra 'jug pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste de la spyi yod pa des na de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra 'jug pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the universal exists in the present, and that the word is applied because of that,

original: yod pa ci 'das pa la sogs pa med pa'i chos su ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ci 'das pa la sogs pa med pa'i chos su ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how can the universal be a property of the nonexistent, the past, etc.?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yod pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: yod pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: Because the universal is not nonexistent.

original: yod pa'i chos su dogs pa bsu ba ni gsal ba gzhan zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: yod pa'i chos su dogs pa bsu ba ni gsal ba gzhan zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The objection that the universal is a property of the existent is anticipated and answered in the words ‚Äúanother manifestation.‚Äù

original: / de'i chos su zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: / de'i chos su zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIt is a property of that.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba'i gsal ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gsal ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: It is the property of the present manifestation.üîΩBut how can it be past?

original: 'o na ji ltar de 'das pa nyid yin zhe na spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de 'das pa nyid yin zhe na spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The universal is not nonexistent.

original: de lta na yang med pa'i chos nyid ni yod pa dang 'gal bas khyab par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang med pa'i chos nyid ni yod pa dang 'gal bas khyab par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, the property of the nonexistent is pervaded by contradiction with the existent. This is stated in the words ‚Äúthe property of the nonexistent.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid ni khyab @80b par byed pa med pa'i chos dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni yin na yang zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni khyab @80b par byed pa med pa'i chos dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni yin na yang zhes bya ba'o /
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù is not contradictory to a property that is not pervaded.

original: 'di gnyis ma nges pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni ci 'gal zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ma nges pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni ci 'gal zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the doubt that these two are not ascertained is, ‚ÄúWhat is the contradiction?‚Äù

original: de 'brel pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de 'brel pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúThere is no connection.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na med pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na med pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is that? He says, ‚ÄúNonexistence . . .‚Äù

original: de lta yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa dang yod pa 'brel pa rtogs pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin no zhes bya ba ni med pa dang yod pa 'brel pa rtogs pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is so‚Äù means that when the connection between existence and nonexistence is understood.

original: spyi yang med pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi yang med pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal is also understood as nonexistent.

original: 'on te med pa rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'on te med pa rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: But if nonexistence cannot be understood,

original: dper na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor example . . .‚Äù

original: med pa rtogs pa med pa rtogs pa bzhin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: med pa rtogs pa med pa rtogs pa bzhin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: is stated. It is connected to ‚Äúlike the understanding of nonexistence.‚Äù

original: gang gis gsal ba kho na med par rtogs pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin pa rtogs pa gnyis ka khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis gsal ba kho na med par rtogs pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin pa rtogs pa gnyis ka khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since there is no difference between the two, the understanding of the individual alone as nonexistent and the understanding of the universal as nonexistent, he says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no difference.‚Äù

original: spyi med pa spang ba'i don to //üîΩgsal ba nyid yod par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyi med pa spang ba'i don to // gsal ba nyid yod par brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout generality‚Äù is ‚Äúwithout exclusion.‚Äù

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúmanifestation itself exists‚ÄùüîΩis the question.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'das pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the past and the future.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: If, he says, is the answer.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is what the other party says.

original: shes pa de yang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: shes pa de yang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: That consciousness, he says, is the philosophical position.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa nyid du na 'das pa nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa nyid du na 'das pa nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is understood to be hidden, then it is past. The response to this qualm is ‚Äúif it is direct perception.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: By its own nature is the answer.

original: des na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dngos po med ces bya ba 'di rnams so //
analyzed: des na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dngos po med ces bya ba 'di rnams so //
translated: Therefore, the past and the future do not exist.

original: de gnas pa na mjug bsdu ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gnas pa na mjug bsdu ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of this is therefore, he says.

original: da ltar ba yod pa la ni bum pa'i sgra gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: da ltar ba yod pa la ni bum pa'i sgra gtso bo yin la /
translated: When the present exists, the sound of pot is primary.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa med pa la ni tshad ma'i yul du gyur pa'i spyi 'am gzhan las nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa med pa la ni tshad ma'i yul du gyur pa'i spyi 'am gzhan las nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The response to the qualm is:

original: gal te nye ra btags las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te nye ra btags las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is imputed in dependence on that.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa la ni spyi nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir na yod pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa med pa'i chos nnyid du ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa la ni spyi nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir na yod pa dang 'gal bas khyab pa med pa'i chos nnyid du ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the universal is imputed in dependence on the past, etc., it is not established as a property that pervades the absence of existence, because it is contradictory that it exists.üîΩThat is explained:

original: de nyid 'chad pa ni med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'chad pa ni med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The property that is absent.

original: khyab par byed pa med pa'i chos dang 'gal ba yod pa zhes bya ba 'di yang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni gang zhig nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa med pa'i chos dang 'gal ba yod pa zhes bya ba 'di yang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni gang zhig nye bar btags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is also not established as the property that pervades the absence of the existent, which is contradictory with the property that pervades the absence of the existent.

original: 'di ni 'dod ces bya ba'i mthar thug pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod ces bya ba'i mthar thug pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained up to the end of the statement:üîΩIf it is imputed in dependence on that.

original: gang gis de nyid la bum pa nyid kyi spyi bar 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: gang gis de nyid la bum pa nyid kyi spyi bar 'dogs kyi /
translated: By what is the universal of pot imputed in that?

original: snam bu la sogs pa ma yin pa 'das pa'i bum pa dang da ltar ba'i bum pa la nye ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa ma yin pa 'das pa'i bum pa dang da ltar ba'i bum pa la nye ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the proximity of a past or present pot to a cloth, etc.?

original: gzhal byar 'dra @81a * //
analyzed: gzhal byar 'dra @81a * //
translated: They are similar in being objects of knowledge.

original: ba las da ltar ba'i bum pa nyid 'das pa la nye bar 'dogs na ni snam bu la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: ba las da ltar ba'i bum pa nyid 'das pa la nye bar 'dogs na ni snam bu la yang khyad par med do //
translated: If the present pot is designated as being near the past pot, then there is no difference with respect to a cloth.

original: des na bum pa 'das so zhes bya ba snam bu 'das so zhes bya ba'i don du 'gyur ro zhes rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: des na bum pa 'das so zhes bya ba snam bu 'das so zhes bya ba'i don du 'gyur ro zhes rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThe pot has passed away‚Äù would have the meaning of ‚ÄúThe cloth has passed away.‚Äù

original: 'dir lan ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir lan ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this objection is as follows.üîΩIf there were no connection, etc.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa la sogs pa med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa la sogs pa med na'o //
translated: If there were no connection, etc.,üîΩthen how could the past and future exist?

original: 'on te 'brel pa'am 'dra ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa'am 'dra ba yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a connection or similarity,

original: med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we reply that it does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yod par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //üîΩrgyal gzhan dag thal ba khas len par 'gyur du 'ong bas 'das pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //üîΩrgyal gzhan dag thal ba khas len par 'gyur du 'ong bas 'das pa la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it follows that they would exist.üîΩThe past and future exist because the present exists.

original: nye bar btags pas kyang med pa la sgra 'jug pa ni dngos po med pa yul can du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar btags pas kyang med pa la sgra 'jug pa ni dngos po med pa yul can du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression even by secondary designation means that the word refers to a non-existent entity, and that it is the subject of the non-existent entity.

original: de ltar 'gyur na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: What is the fault if it is so?

original: de yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says that also.

original: sgra'i brjod bya dngos po med pa la brten pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: sgra'i brjod bya dngos po med pa la brten pa'i spyi'o //
translated: The general referent of the word is based on the non-existent entity.üîΩTherefore, he says then.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la brten pas na dngos po med pa 'grub ste ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa la brten pas na dngos po med pa 'grub ste ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it is based on the non-existent entity, the non-existent entity is established, like the horn of a rabbit, etc.üîΩHe says in that.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la nye bar 'dogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la nye bar 'dogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in the secondary designation of the manifest.

original: nye bar yod pa yang ma yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar yod pa yang ma yin zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is not even secondary existence, that is the intention.üîΩ This very point is stated in the second verse:

original: 'di nyid gnyis pa la yang gsungs pa ni sgra nye bar 'dogs pa la yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid gnyis pa la yang gsungs pa ni sgra nye bar 'dogs pa la yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says even in the secondary designation of the word.

original: nye bar yod dgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar yod dgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: It must be secondary existence, etc.

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la don bya ba med pa des na da ltar ba'i bum pa dang 'brel pa de de dag la nye bar 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la don bya ba med pa des na da ltar ba'i bum pa dang 'brel pa de de dag la nye bar 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: If the past and future do not perform the function of a vase, then the connection with the present vase is imputed to them.

original: da ltar ba'i bum pa dang rdzas kyi rang bzhin du gcig pas 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i bum pa dang rdzas kyi rang bzhin du gcig pas 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are similar to the present vase, since they are the same in substance.

original: des na sgra 'jug pa yin no snyam pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na sgra 'jug pa yin no snyam pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the word is applied.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang ngo //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang ngo //
translated: Because they are the same, as the present.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa nyid ni dus su rgyu ba tsam yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa gcig tu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa nyid ni dus su rgyu ba tsam yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa 'das pa la sogs pa gcig tu brjod pa yin no //
translated: The past, etc. are merely the movement in time, he says, because the past, etc. are stated as one in regard to seeing, etc.

original: ji ltar gcig nyid kyi phyir 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig nyid kyi phyir 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: How are they similar because they are the same?

original: 'das ba ni de nyid yin te zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'das ba ni de nyid yin te zhes smras te /
translated: The past is just that, he says.

original: da ltar ba nyid do //
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid do //
translated: The present.

original: 'o na ci 'dogs snyam pa ni 'on kyang zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'o na ci 'dogs snyam pa ni 'on kyang zhes smras so //
translated: But what is it that is imputed?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs la'o //
translated: In that case, in the state of the past, etc.

original: spyi lta bur zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa yin yang don bya ba dang bral ba nyid kyis spyi lta bur rtogs pa yin no //üîΩgzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don bya ba gtso @81b bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: spyi lta bur zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa yin yang don bya ba dang bral ba nyid kyis spyi lta bur rtogs pa yin no // gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don bya ba gtso @81b bo nyid yin na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike a universal‚Äù means that although the essence of a thing is realized, it is realized as if it were a universal, because it is devoid of the activity of an object.

original: da ltar ba'i rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa'i dngos po nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi dus de dang thun mong ba nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa'i dngos po nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi dus de dang thun mong ba nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Otherwise, it is not, means that if the activity of an object is primary, then the thing itself, which is of the nature of the present, is realized, but not its commonality with time.

original: len ni 'o na ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: len ni 'o na ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa da ltar ba dang lhan cig gcig yin na dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad da ltar ba'i rang bzhin du yod pas ji ltar 'das pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa da ltar ba dang lhan cig gcig yin na dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad da ltar ba'i rang bzhin du yod pas ji ltar 'das pa nyid yin /
translated: If the past, etc., were the same as the present, then since all the aspects of a thing would exist in the nature of the present, how could they be past?

original: don bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir 'das pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: don bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir 'das pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In response to the doubt that they are past because they are devoid of the activity of an object, he says:

original: de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That.

original: de don byed pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de don byed pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected to the statement: ‚ÄúIt is past because it does not perform the activity of an object.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba bzhin du don bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin yang don gyi rang bzhin ni spyi nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba bzhin du don bya ba dang bral ba nyid yin yang don gyi rang bzhin ni spyi nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is devoid of the activity of the present, the nature of the object is not a universal,

original: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the appearances are different.

original: ji ltar 'das pa dngos po yin zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dngos po yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: How can the past be a thing?üîΩThe past is a thing because it possesses the activity of the past.

original: 'das pa'i don bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na dngos po yin yang 'das pa nyid yin no snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'das pa'i don bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir na dngos po yin yang 'das pa nyid yin no snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: The response to the doubt that the past is a thing because it possesses the activity of the past is:

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it possesses that.

original: de dang ldan par cis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de dang ldan par cis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúHow can it possess that?‚Äù

original: yod pa ni med pa dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni med pa dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: is that an existent is not understood to be related to a non-existent.

original: khas blangs nas kyang skyon brjod pa na shes na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang skyon brjod pa na shes na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúIf it is understood, what is the use of the word?‚Äù

original: don bya ba dang bral ba bzhin du spyi med pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don bya ba dang bral ba bzhin du spyi med pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: is that just as it is devoid of the activity of the present, it is understood to be devoid of a universal.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni don bya ba ni don bya ba med do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'brel te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni don bya ba ni don bya ba med do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'brel te /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúthe activity of an object does not exist‚Äù is not related to the meaning of the statement.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad yod ces blta ba las 'das pa de'i don byed pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad yod ces blta ba las 'das pa de'i don byed pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: Because when one transcends the view that ‚Äúeverything exists,‚Äù the activity of an object also exists.

original: de lta ma yin na don byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don byed pa bzhin du /
translated: If that were not so, then just like the activity of an object,

original: dngos po yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the object itself would not exist.

original: don bya ba de yod pa yin na yang 'das pa'i dngos po'i med pa de 'das pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don bya ba de yod pa yin na yang 'das pa'i dngos po'i med pa de 'das pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the activity of an object exists, then how could the nonexistence of a past object be past? It could not be! This is the meaning.üîΩThis is the proof of that.

original: 'di grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'di grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating this, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúBut if it is said that the past and future exist as objects of knowledge,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how could they be nonexistent?‚Äù

original: lan ni kun rdzob 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni kun rdzob 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThis conventional reality.‚Äù

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don shes pa'i dmigs par yod pa nyid yin no ;
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don shes pa'i dmigs par yod pa nyid yin no ;
translated: If the past and future exist as objects of knowledge,

original: / de'i tshe 'di ci zhig kun rdzob nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: / de'i tshe 'di ci zhig kun rdzob nyid ma yin te /
translated: then how could they not be conventional reality?

original: ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: They could not be!

original: mtha' dag don dam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtha' dag don dam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that all of them are ultimate,

original: da ltar ba bzhin du shes pa 'das pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba bzhin du shes pa 'das pa la sogs pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like the present, they are cognized by consciousness.

original: 'o na kun rdzob bden pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩkun rdzob bden @82a * //
analyzed: 'o na kun rdzob bden pa nyid do zhe na / kun rdzob bden @82a * //
translated: Well, then, they are conventional truths.

original: par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How could they be conventional truths?

original: ci'i phyir bden pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bden pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not truths?

original: med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: because they are nonexistent.

original: shes pas dmigs pa'i phyogs la kun rdzob med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pas dmigs pa'i phyogs la kun rdzob med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that in the position that they are objects of consciousness, they are not conventional.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa kun rdzob yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs la ni don dam pa med do zhes brjod pa ni ;
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa kun rdzob yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs la ni don dam pa med do zhes brjod pa ni ;
translated: In the position that the past, etc. are conventional, it is said that the ultimate does not exist.üîΩIf,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlan ni 'das pa la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o // lan ni 'das pa la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reply is,üîΩbecause the past, etc. are not ultimate,

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa la sogs pa don dam pa ma yin pa'i rgyu des na de'i tshe chos su gyur pa'i tshe dngos po med do zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa la sogs pa don dam pa ma yin pa'i rgyu des na de'i tshe chos su gyur pa'i tshe dngos po med do zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: at that time, when they are phenomena, they do not exist as things.

original: ji ltar de'i chos nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i chos nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How could they be its reality?

original: da ltar ba tsam gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da ltar ba tsam gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: Only the present is mentioned.

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For that reason is the summary of the section.

original: dngos po brjod byar khas blangs na ni nye bar btags par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dngos po brjod byar khas blangs na ni nye bar btags par mi 'thad de /
translated: If you accept that the thing is the object of expression, then the designation is not tenable,

original: dngos po nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is a thing.

original: dngos po med pa brjod par bya ba yin na ni 'gyur ba yin no //
