original: de la the tshom yin na ni mthong ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de la the tshom yin na ni mthong ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes dogs na /
translated: then if there is doubt about that, there will be doubt about what is seen.

original: mthong ba nyid dpag bya yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid dpag bya yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that what is seen is what is to be inferred.

original: de gnyis ni gcig nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gcig nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the two are not the same.

original: snang bzhin pa'i skad cig ma nyid ni g-yo ba ma yin mod kyi mi gsal bas na rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i skad cig ma nyid ni g-yo ba ma yin mod kyi mi gsal bas na rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The momentariness that appears does not move, but because it is not clear, it is only a non-conceptual thought that accords with it.

original: de bas na mthong bas ni g-yo ba ma yin no zhes rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mthong bas ni g-yo ba ma yin no zhes rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that what is seen does not move.

original: gal te don bzhin du snang ba la yang rjes su dpag pa ji ltar mi g-yo snyam na snang ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te don bzhin du snang ba la yang rjes su dpag pa ji ltar mi g-yo snyam na snang ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is thought that even when appearing like an object, how can inference not move, it is said that it is in the appearance.

original: mngon sum nyid du yang mtshungs pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du yang mtshungs pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is only that it is not equal to direct perception.

original: de bas na g-yo ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na g-yo ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it does not move.

original: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tha dad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tha dad ce na /
translated: Well then, how are direct perception and inference different?

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po la ltos nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po la ltos nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is in dependence on external things.

original: mngon sum dang der snang ba nyid kyis tha dad pa yang phyi'i dngos po la ltos pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis so ;
analyzed: mngon sum dang der snang ba nyid kyis tha dad pa yang phyi'i dngos po la ltos pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis so ;
translated: The word ‚Äúthen‚Äù refers to the nature of the manifestation.üîΩ‚Äú Some‚Äù refers to the appearances of those with eye disease and so on.

original: /'ga' zhig ces bya bar rab rib can la sogs pa'i snang ba dang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyang mngon sum ltar snang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: /'ga' zhig ces bya bar rab rib can la sogs pa'i snang ba dang rjes su dpag pa nyid kyang mngon sum ltar snang ba nyid yin te /
translated: Inference is also like a direct perception.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnam par rig pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /üîΩde'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du rjes @87a * //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba rnam par rig pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te / de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du rjes @87a * //
translated: The meaning is that the classification of direct perception, inference, and so on is not dependent on consciousness.

original: su dpag pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: su dpag pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin snang ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like direct perception, inference does not manifest the nature of things.

original: yang na de snang ba yin du zin kyang de tsam gyis na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la mi slu ba med na tshad ma ma yin te rab rib las byung ba bzhin no zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de snang ba yin du zin kyang de tsam gyis na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la mi slu ba med na tshad ma ma yin te rab rib las byung ba bzhin no zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, even if it does appear, if it is not nondeceptive with regard to the nature of what is to be arisen, it is not a valid cognition, like that arising from cataracts.

original: rjes su dpag pa de bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de bden pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: How could that inference be true?

original: gzhan gyis 'gyur te zhes smras te bden par zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'gyur te zhes smras te bden par zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is said that it is true, and it is connected with ‚Äútrue.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni zhes bya ba smos te rjes su dpag pa de ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba smos te rjes su dpag pa de ni'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthat,‚Äù which is the inference.

original: rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: Because it is understood, that is, by direct perception.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: If, it is a philosophical position.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan gyis shes pas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan gyis shes pas so //
translated: There, it is said that it is understood by another person.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba ni rab rib las byung ba yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba ni rab rib las byung ba yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With regard to the nature of what is to be arisen, that is, because the present is also arisen from cataracts.

original: de zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan gyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan gyis shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition of another person.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab rib can gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab rib can gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why the text speaks of ‚Äúthe person with myodesopsia.‚Äù

original: mi bden pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan gyi mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mi bden pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gzhan gyi mngon sum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be utterly false‚Äù refers to the direct perception of another person.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid du rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu gzhan gyis kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid du rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the object that is to be cognized by another person is also to be understood as being like the nature of the object that is to be cognized by the person with myodesopsia.

original: rang bzhin de la ni mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de la ni mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: That nature is not directly perceived.

original: des na skyes bu gzhan gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas ji ltar ma grub pa nyid kyis ma grub pa sgrub pa de'i phyir skyes bu gzhan gyis shes pa las ni yul dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des na skyes bu gzhan gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pas ji ltar ma grub pa nyid kyis ma grub pa sgrub pa de'i phyir skyes bu gzhan gyis shes pa las ni yul dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the object that is to be cognized by another person is also inference. So, just as the object that is to be cognized by the person with myodesopsia is not established, the object that is to be cognized by another person is not established. Therefore, the object that is to be cognized by another person does not exist.

original: des na rab rib can gyis shes pa bzhin du yul med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'o na de ma 'ongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul can nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: des na rab rib can gyis shes pa bzhin du yul med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'o na de ma 'ongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul can nyid yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, just like the cognition of the person with myodesopsia, the object does not exist.üîΩWell, if the object that is to be cognized by another person does not exist, then the object that is to be cognized by the person with myodesopsia must exist.

original: ji ltar yul med par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar yul med par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How can the object be nonexistent?

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin srid pa yin yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin srid pa yin yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúalthough the nature of the future exists.‚Äù

original: 'on te de srid pa ni yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de srid pa ni yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that existence does exist,

original: de ni de'i tshe zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the future.

original: dngos po'i yul can ni dngos po snang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can ni dngos po snang ba'o //
translated: The object of an entity is the appearance of an entity.üîΩIf inference has no object in this way, then direct perception would be the same.

original: gal te de ltar rjes su dpag pa yul med pa yin nam mngon sum yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid la ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar rjes su dpag pa yul med pa yin nam mngon sum yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o // de nyid la ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is, ‚ÄúDirect perception also . . .‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the future.

original: 'di ga las she na 'di ltar de las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na 'di ltar de las zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äú From that‚Äù means from the future.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pas so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pas so //
translated: If it were not so,

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the response.

original: des na @87b zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin mi snang bas so //
analyzed: des na @87b zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin mi snang bas so //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because the nature of an entity does not appear.

original: med pa la yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'dzin par mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa la yang zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'dzin par mtshungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means that the apprehension of what is not the nature of an entity is similar.

original: mngon sum gyi blo yang de lta bu nyid yin nam ci snyam na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo yang de lta bu nyid yin nam ci snyam na /
translated: Is the cognition of direct perception also like that?

original: mngon sum gyi blo ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi blo ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of direct perception . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa la mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDoes not occur in regard to what is not an entity‚Äù means that it apprehends an entity.

original: dngos po med pa'i yul can kho na gtso bo ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i yul can kho na gtso bo ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating the doubt that the cognition of what is not an entity is not the principal characteristic, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is argued . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa thams cad btags par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thams cad btags par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúInference . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i yul can no ;
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i yul can no ;
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the cognition of what is not an entity.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na phyin ci log tu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na phyin ci log tu zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why? He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is erroneous . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po'i yul can yang dngos po ma yin pa dang dngos po'i yul can yang dngos su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can yang dngos po ma yin pa dang dngos po'i yul can yang dngos su mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i rtogs pa'i yul nyid de /

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni /

analyzed: dngos po dang cig shos kyi yul can nyid do //
translated: The subject is the object of a thing and its opposite.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //

original: de lta na ci zhig 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na ci zhig 'grub snyam na /
translated: What is established by that?

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúby inference.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni nye bar btags pa 'khrul par rtogs pa'i yul nyid kyang 'das pa la sogs pa la ni med pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni nye bar btags pa 'khrul par rtogs pa'i yul nyid kyang 'das pa la sogs pa la ni med pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúvase,‚Äù etc., is the object of a mistaken designation. But it does not exist for the past, etc. He says, ‚Äúbecause of that,‚Äù

original: dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa da ltar ba la ste yod pa'am med pa la yang de 'dra ba nyid de dang mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa da ltar ba la ste yod pa'am med pa la yang de 'dra ba nyid de dang mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: because it is not the object of a thing. It is the same for the present, the existent or the non-existent.

original: de byas pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de byas pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is, it is similar. There is no difference in the action.

original: mngon sum la ni med pa la mi 'byung ba nyid do zhes khyad par brjod pa ni snang ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la ni med pa la mi 'byung ba nyid do zhes khyad par brjod pa ni snang ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In direct perception, it does not occur in the non-existent. He says, ‚Äúlight, etc.,‚Äù to state the difference.

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ni blo 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa de nyid /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ni blo 'khrul pa med par 'jug pa de nyid /
translated: If it is argued that the mind does not engage in error with respect to the past and future,

original: spyi tsam 'dzin pas don yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi tsam 'dzin pas don yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends a mere universal,

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i blo yang ji ltar btags pa zhig spyi yul can nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i blo yang ji ltar btags pa zhig spyi yul can nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: then the mind that conceives of a principal cause and so on is also the subject that apprehends a mere universal.

original: spyi tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is ‚Äúa mere universal.‚Äù

original: sems gnyis dag na ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang cig shos kyi yul can dag go //
analyzed: sems gnyis dag na ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba dang cig shos kyi yul can dag go //
translated: ‚Äú If two minds‚Äù refers to the two subjects that have the present and the other as their objects.

original: gsal ba'i mthar thug pa ma yin pa na de spyi ma yin pa la 'das pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba'i mthar thug pa ma yin pa na de spyi ma yin pa la 'das pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: If the universal is not a final particular, then it is not past and so on.

original: de 'ba' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is ‚Äúthat alone.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú Already refuted‚Äù refers to

original: bzlog zin to zhes bya ba ni //üîΩde mtshungs min dang gsal ba yin //
analyzed: bzlog zin to zhes bya ba ni // de mtshungs min dang gsal ba yin //
translated: the passage:

original: zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: It is not similar to that, it is a particular.

original: 'ba' zhig @88b 'dzin par khas blangs nas sun 'byin par brjod pa de ni spyi tsam zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig @88b 'dzin par khas blangs nas sun 'byin par brjod pa de ni spyi tsam zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: That is, the response is that the refutation expressed by accepting that it apprehends that alone is a mere universal.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That alone‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: gal te tha dad pa dang 'ba' zhig pa bzung na ni spyi ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa dang 'ba' zhig pa bzung na ni spyi ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were apprehended as different and alone, it would not be a universal.üîΩThere is no fault in the case of what is not different.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa la ni nyes pa 'di med do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa la ni nyes pa 'di med do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The response to the doubt is ‚ÄúBut if it is not different, whose is the nondifference?‚Äù

original: / khyad par med pa ni gang gi yin te /
analyzed: / khyad par med pa ni gang gi yin te /
translated: Whose is the nondifference?

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'am phyi rol gyi yin de la dang po sel ba ni gal te shes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'am phyi rol gyi yin de la dang po sel ba ni gal te shes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is it of the nature of cognition or of external things? The first is refuted in the statement ‚ÄúIf it is of the nature of cognition.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa slob pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa slob pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is refuted in the statement ‚ÄúBut if it is of the nature of external things.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par med 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khyad par med 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the apprehension of nondifference.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means essence.

original: gsal ba rnams kyi rang bzhin ni phan tshun bzlog par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams kyi rang bzhin ni phan tshun bzlog par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The natures of the manifest are held to be mutually exclusive.

original: ldog pa ma yin pa nyid du ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ma yin pa nyid du ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to understand that they are not mutually exclusive.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa ni de la reg pa ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa ni de la reg pa ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the response to the doubt is ‚ÄúBut that also is not so.‚Äù

original: phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni gcig tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni gcig tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because mutually contradictory things cannot reasonably be one.

original: 'on te de ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: But it is the nature of both.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
translated: Even if it has two natures,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is still not seen.

original: mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ba lang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ba lang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm that it is not tenable that it is seen is ‚Äúthe cow.‚Äù

original: rjes su song ba ni ma mthong ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gzhan la 'dri ba ni rjes su song ba zhes bya ba 'di zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su song ba ni ma mthong ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gzhan la 'dri ba ni rjes su song ba zhes bya ba 'di zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not seen, he asks another question: ‚ÄúWhat is this ‚Äògone beyond‚Äô?‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi ba lang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ba lang zhes smos so //
translated: The other‚Äôs cow is mentioned.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù refers to the conclusion.

original: de lta'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rjes su song ba la yang rjes su song ba gzhan yod pa de'i tshe thug pa med do //
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rjes su song ba la yang rjes su song ba gzhan yod pa de'i tshe thug pa med do //
translated: If it is so, if the gone beyond also has another gone beyond, then there is an infinite regress.

original: rjes su song ba dang po bzhin du rjes su song ba dang po'i rjes su song ba gzhan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su song ba dang po bzhin du rjes su song ba dang po'i rjes su song ba gzhan khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the first gone beyond, you accept another gone beyond of the first gone beyond.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: The same is true of the other.

original: thug pa med par thal ba spang ba'i don du tha mi dad pa'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal ba spang ba'i don du tha mi dad pa'i phyogs kyi dogs pa bsu ba ni de ni zhes bya ba'o // de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In order to avoid the absurdity of an infinite regress, he anticipates the objection that they are not different:üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature that is transferred.

original: de'i ni rjes su song ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i ni rjes su song ba can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature that is transferred.

original: ci 'di zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'di zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù is the refutation.

original: gang gis de ni de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes brjod par 'gyur ba ci 'di rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba gsal ba las tha dad par dmigs sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis de ni de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid do zhes brjod par 'gyur ba ci 'di rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba gsal ba las tha dad par dmigs sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù means: is it perceived as different from the manifest, by virtue of which it is said that it is the nature of that?

original: rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù is by means of perception.

original: 'di snyam du rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin ni gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir na rnam pa gnyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma @89a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin ni gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir na rnam pa gnyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma @89a * //
translated: He anticipates the objection that the nature that is transferred is not perceived in two ways, because it is the nature of the manifest:

original: yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat nature‚Äù refers to the nature that is transferred.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhe na gal te gsal ba'i rang bzhin ldog pa med pa gcig yin na de'i tshe gsal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhe na gal te gsal ba'i rang bzhin ldog pa med pa gcig yin na de'i tshe gsal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of manifestation is not reversed, then at that time it would not be manifestation.

original: de ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The response is that it is called ‚Äúnature‚Äù because it is the nature of manifestation.

original: rjes su song ba ni phan tshun 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su song ba ni phan tshun 'dres pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Conjoined‚Äù means mutually mixed.

original: de nyid yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is what is called ‚Äúidentity.‚Äù

original: spyi ni re zhig gsal ba med kyang gnas so zhe na de lta na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spyi ni re zhig gsal ba med kyang gnas so zhe na de lta na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If the universal exists even when there is no manifestation, then it would be like that.

original: gsal ba med par gyur na spyi med de mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni spyi yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba med par gyur na spyi med de mtshungs pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni spyi yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the manifestation does not exist, the universal does not exist, because the nature of the similar is the universal, according to our philosophical system.

original: 'on te yang rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba rnams kyi ngo bo ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But if the nature of the universal is not conjoined with the manifestation,

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa yin te /
translated: then it is different.

original: des na de dag med pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa ni 'on te de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de dag med pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa ni 'on te de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not nonexistent.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúEven so . . . ‚Äù

original: tha dad par khas blangs kyang spyi yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par khas blangs kyang spyi yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one accepts that they are different, the universal does not exist,

original: mngon sum la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear in perception.

original: gal te yang mngon sum gyis gnyi ga ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum gyis gnyi ga ma yin mod /
translated: Even if the universal does not appear in perception,

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa dang lhan cig pas ni dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa dang lhan cig pas ni dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: nevertheless, it is apprehended by the conceptual cognition that accompanies perception.

original: dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúIt is apprehended only . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe cognition of the universal and the cognition of the particular are perceptions.

original: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su song ba'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The cognition that has the form of the universal is conceptual.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni dngos po la bdag nyid gnyis med na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni dngos po la bdag nyid gnyis med na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if the thing does not have two natures,

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi shes pa'o //
translated: then this cognition of the universal is not a perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis byas nas re zhig dang po sel ba ni rjes su song ba'i rnam par shes pa yin no zhes brjod na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis byas nas re zhig dang po sel ba ni rjes su song ba'i rnam par shes pa yin no zhes brjod na zhes 'brel to //
translated: Having made the distinction between the two kinds of conceptualization, he says, ‚ÄúFirst, if you say that the consciousness that goes after the object is the one that eliminates the object, then . . .‚Äù

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni shes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy it‚Äù means by the consciousness.

original: ci ste shes pa'i rjes su spong ba bzhin du mi 'thad pas don rjes su song ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni don rjes su song ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste shes pa'i rjes su spong ba bzhin du mi 'thad pas don rjes su song ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni don rjes su song ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that it is not tenable that the object is gone after in the same way that it is eliminated by the consciousness, then he says, ‚ÄúBecause it goes after the object . . .‚Äù

original: 'di sngon po'i zhes bya ba bzhin du 'di spyi'i zhes bya bar yang mdzub mos ci ston zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di sngon po'i zhes bya ba bzhin du 'di spyi'i zhes bya bar yang mdzub mos ci ston zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: If you say that it is like ‚ÄúThis is blue,‚Äù then he replies, ‚ÄúWhat does the finger point to when it says ‚ÄòThis is a universal‚Äô?‚Äù

original: de nyid ces pa don nyid de ltar rjes su song ba nyid du bsnyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces pa don nyid de ltar rjes su song ba nyid du bsnyad par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat very thing‚Äù means the object. It should be explained that it goes after the object in that way.

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like ‚Äúblue‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba rjes su song ba'i shes pa la bsnyad pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba rjes su song ba'i shes pa la bsnyad pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the point of saying ‚Äúin relation to another,‚Äù that is, in relation to the consciousness that goes after the object?

original: 'on te thams cad gzhan te mi la 'thad pa'i sgo @89b nas bsnyad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad gzhan te mi la 'thad pa'i sgo @89b nas bsnyad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that everything is different and that it is explained in terms of what is tenable for a human being,

original: sngon po la sogs pa dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúblue, etc.‚Äù

original: mdo sde pa'i lugs la brten nas bshad pa ni sngon po la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i lugs la brten nas bshad pa ni sngon po la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation based on the SautrƒÅntika system is ‚Äúblue, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes pa la bsnyad pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes pa la bsnyad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the explanation.

original: 'di ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /üîΩgal te 'ga' zhig de ltar tha snyad byed pa de lta na yang 'jig rten ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don ni 'di yin te / gal te 'ga' zhig de ltar tha snyad byed pa de lta na yang 'jig rten ni ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not so‚Äù means that the meaning of the response is as follows:

original: 'on kyang sngon po dang ser po dag shes pa las sam phan tshun tha dad par rtogs te sngon po mthong ngo zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po dang ser po dag shes pa las sam phan tshun tha dad par rtogs te sngon po mthong ngo zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Even if someone uses such expressions, the world does not understand that blue and yellow are different from consciousness or different from each other, as in ‚ÄúI see blue.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du spyi la yang 'di rnams la rjes su song ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi la yang 'di rnams la rjes su song ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, in the case of universals, one understands that these pervade many things,

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes tha dad par rigs par 'gyur ro //üîΩthal ba las ldog par khas len pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes tha dad par rigs par 'gyur ro // thal ba las ldog par khas len pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: but one does not understand that they are different from those things.

original: de ni tha dad du bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni tha dad du bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection that the consequence is accepted is ‚ÄúThey are not different.‚Äù

original: 'di bzlog pa'i don du rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni 'o na da ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i don du rgyu mtshan 'dri ba ni 'o na da ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to refute this, the reason is asked: ‚ÄúWell then, now what?‚Äù

original: gzhan rgyu mtshan smra ba ni bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rgyu mtshan smra ba ni bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other one states the reason: ‚Äúbecause it cannot be taught.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med par brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med par brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement without a reason because of the perception of contradiction is ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not to be established.‚Äù

original: grub na yang zhes bya ba smos pa'o //
analyzed: grub na yang zhes bya ba smos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is established,‚Äù he says.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven pleasure, etc.,‚Äù is the dispute.

original: de dag kyang ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù are pleasure, etc.

original: rang rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-awareness‚Äù is the answer.

original: bde ba bstan par bya ba'i rgyud la yod pa zhes bstan par bya ba'i rgyud la yod pa de ni bstan pa don med do zhes brjod pa ni khyod la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba bstan par bya ba'i rgyud la yod pa zhes bstan par bya ba'i rgyud la yod pa de ni bstan pa don med do zhes brjod pa ni khyod la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which exists in the continuum of the one to whom it is to be taught,‚Äù that is taught. ‚ÄúThat is pointless,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúFor you,‚Äù is the statement.

original: mngon sum gyi don la ni nye bar bstan pa chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don la ni nye bar bstan pa chen po ma yin no //
translated: In the case of the meaning of direct perception, there is no great demonstration.

original: phyogs gnyis la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis te tshig gam rtags las rtogs par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis te tshig gam rtags las rtogs par bya ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There are two alternatives for each of the two, i.e., the word and the mark, i.e., that it is to be understood.

original: dang po ni khyed ces bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba nas ma yin te zhes bya bas 'gog pa'o //üîΩgnyis ba la brjod pa ni 'on te spu ldang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni khyed ces bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba nas ma yin te zhes bya bas 'gog pa'o // gnyis ba la brjod pa ni 'on te spu ldang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first is the objection beginning with ‚ÄúIf you say‚Äù and the refutation is by ‚ÄúNo!‚ÄùüîΩThe second is the statement beginning with ‚ÄúBut if you say that the word ‚Äòpleasure‚Äô is applied to the body because it is the substratum of pleasure.‚Äù

original: 'on te yang de la bde ba yod do zhes ma brjod par rtags las ni mi rtogs so snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩspyi grub pa la yang tshul 'di 'dra bar dogs pa bsu ba ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te yang de la bde ba yod do zhes ma brjod par rtags las ni mi rtogs so snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so // spyi grub pa la yang tshul 'di 'dra bar dogs pa bsu ba ni 'dir yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The objection is anticipated by ‚ÄúBut if you say that pleasure exists there‚Äù and the refutation is by ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: spyi grub pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: spyi grub pa la yang ngo //
translated: The objection is anticipated by ‚ÄúIn the case of the establishment of universals‚Äù and the refutation is by ‚ÄúHere also.‚ÄùüîΩThe refutation is by ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: lan ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is by ‚ÄúBut it is not so.‚Äù

original: rjes su song ba'i rtog pa ni bag chags las byung ba las na spyi don gyis 'phen par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'on kyang 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su song ba'i rtog pa ni bag chags las byung ba las na spyi don gyis 'phen par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'on kyang 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated by ‚ÄúThe conceptual cognition that occurs through the power of the latent impressions does not project the universal by the meaning.‚Äù The refutation is by ‚ÄúBut this is not so.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid gsal @90a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal @90a * //
translated: This is clarified by the following:

original: bar byed pa ni 'di'i rgyu mtshan ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar byed pa ni 'di'i rgyu mtshan ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for this is stated:

original: ji ltar bag chags nyid 'di'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi spyi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bag chags nyid 'di'i rgyu mtshan yin gyi spyi ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the residual impression itself is the reason for this, and not the universal?

original: tha dad par dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha dad par dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the difference,

original: skabs sdud par byed pa ni spyi gzhan nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs sdud par byed pa ni spyi gzhan nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is stated: The difference of another universal,

original: 'o na gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gzhan dang gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But it would be different and not different.

original: gzhan dang gzhan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The difference of another is stated.

original: rnam pa gzhan yod pa nyid na 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yod pa nyid na 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there were another aspect, it would be.

original: ji ltar de khas blangs kyang rnam pa gzhan srid par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de khas blangs kyang rnam pa gzhan srid par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if it is accepted, how could another aspect be possible?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus is stated.

original: gal te de lta na yang tha dad pa ma yin pa tha dad pa ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang tha dad pa ma yin pa tha dad pa ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if it is so, why would nondifference not be different?üîΩThe reversal of that is stated:

original: bzlog pas de nyid gang yin pa /
analyzed: bzlog pas de nyid gang yin pa /
translated: That which is the same as that,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, there is no feeling, and so on.

original: bzlog pa ste tha dad pas de nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlog pa ste tha dad pas de nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The opposite of that is different. The meaning is: what is that?

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means otherness.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not other.

original: tshor ba med pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because feeling is contradictory.

original: de'i phyir tha mi dad pa ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha mi dad pa ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, non-difference means not different. This is the meaning.

original: gal te tha dad pa ni tha mi dad pa nyid du rigs pa nyid de mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa zhes bsams nas gzhan dag slong bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ni tha mi dad pa nyid du rigs pa nyid de mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa zhes bsams nas gzhan dag slong bar byed pa ni /
translated: If difference is reasonable as non-difference, then seeing is not reasonable. Thinking this, others raise an objection:

original: lag dub nyid dang tha dad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lag dub nyid dang tha dad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the hand and the arm are different‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: lag dub sogs pas zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: lag dub sogs pas zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúBecause the hand and so on‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni tshad ma 'dri ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù asks for the evidence.

original: bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang don 'phen par byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to zhes bya bar bshad pa ni rjes su 'gro bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang don 'phen par byed pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to zhes bya bar bshad pa ni rjes su 'gro bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It has already been explained that conceptual thoughts arising from latent predispositions do not project objects. This is the explanation of ‚Äúbecause they are not concomitant.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the universal.

original: med pa nyid du bstan zin to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid du bstan zin to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready shown to be nonexistent‚Äù refers to the previous discussion.

original: spyi tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the universal is something different,

original: 'brel pa med pa nyid brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa nyid brjod pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the question is asked: ‚ÄúWhy is there no connection?‚Äù

original: 'di nyid rtsa ba dang sgrib par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rtsa ba dang sgrib par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù and this is the obscuration.

original: gal te mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba de dag las gzhan nyid yin par gyur na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gal te mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba de dag las gzhan nyid yin par gyur na zhes 'brel to //
translated: The root text continues, ‚ÄúIf the nature of the similarity were something different from those . . . ‚Äù

original: rta nyid ni khra bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pa kho nas yin pas na khyad par du byed pa ni de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rta nyid ni khra bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pa kho nas yin pas na khyad par du byed pa ni de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since the nature of a horse is not connected to a cow, etc., the root text specifies ‚Äúthose‚Äù in order to indicate that the nature of a horse is not connected to anything other than a horse.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to this is stated in the root text: ‚ÄúThe nature of a horse . . . ‚Äù

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i spyi ni dngos po ma yin pas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i spyi ni dngos po ma yin pas tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Since the universal that is the opposite of something else is not a real thing, the universal is imagined to be either different from or the same as the things that possess it.

original: bzhi pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is stated in the root text: ‚ÄúThe fourth . . . ‚Äù The word ‚Äúfourth‚Äù refers to the fourth alternative.

original: rnam par rtog pas ni dngos po de ma yin pa las ldog par mtshungs pa bzhin @90b du zhen par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ni dngos po de ma yin pa las ldog par mtshungs pa bzhin @90b du zhen par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that conceptual thought apprehends the thing as being similar to the exclusion of what is not that.

original: yang na gal te de dag gi mtshungs pa'i dngos po de yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: yang na gal te de dag gi mtshungs pa'i dngos po de yin par 'dod na /
translated: Or else, if you maintain that the universal is that which is the same as those,

original: de'i tshe de dag las gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag las gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur zhes 'brel to //
translated: then at that time it would be different from them.

original: gal te bum pa ni spyi'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir na snam bu'i spyi ma yin gyi snam bu nyid ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i spyi yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bum pa ni spyi'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir na snam bu'i spyi ma yin gyi snam bu nyid ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i spyi yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you suspect that a pot is not the universal of cloth because it is not the universal nature itself, but cloth is its universal because it is its nature, then the response is because it is not the nature of a universal.

original: lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the response is this.

original: spyi'i rang bzhin nyid la yang gsal ba dang 'brel pa med pa ni de'i gnas skabs nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin nyid la yang gsal ba dang 'brel pa med pa ni de'i gnas skabs nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if it is the universal nature itself, it is not related to the manifestation, because it is its state.

original: 'brel pa grub pa'i rgyu brjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub pa'i rgyu brjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the reason for establishing the relation is that and.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub byed du 'gyur na ni thams cad grub po zhes brjod pa ni de ni 'byung ba yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid sgrub byed du 'gyur na ni thams cad grub po zhes brjod pa ni de ni 'byung ba yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by ‚Äúthat is the origination.‚Äù

original: gnyug ma nyid la yang rnam pa 'di nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gnyug ma nyid la yang rnam pa 'di nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This very form is also in the intrinsic nature, it is said.

original: 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: That very thing is the connection.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ma grub kyang gtan tshigs nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni ma grub kyang gtan tshigs nyid yin na'o //
translated: If it were not so, then even if it were not established, it would be the reason.

original: 'dis ni spyi'i rang bzhin nyid khas blangs nas gsal ba dang 'brel pa ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyi'i rang bzhin nyid khas blangs nas gsal ba dang 'brel pa ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that, having accepted the intrinsic nature of the universal, the connection with the particular is not established.

original: de ni spyi'i bdag nyid kyang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni spyi'i mngon par dogs pa las yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni spyi'i bdag nyid kyang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni spyi'i mngon par dogs pa las yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not even established as the nature of the universal, it is said.

original: 'brel pa grub par khas blangs nas skyon brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub par khas blangs nas skyon brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having accepted the establishment of the connection, the fault is stated by ‚ÄúBut if‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'brel pa ni rang bzhin nyid ma bzung ba'i phyir na nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni rang bzhin nyid ma bzung ba'i phyir na nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is no fault because the connection is not taken to be the intrinsic nature,üîΩthen the reply is this.

original: 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: The nature of the relation is stated.üîΩThe nature of that is difference.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni gzhan nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta na yang 'brel pa nyid brjod pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni gzhan nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o // de lta na yang 'brel pa nyid brjod pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The response to the doubt is:

original: rnam par mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: rnam par mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba'o ;
translated: The similarity of the aspects.

original: / ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The similarity of the aspects.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig la ltos pa de ma bzung bar ni de mi 'dzin to zhes brjod pa ni gsal ba la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig la ltos pa de ma bzung bar ni de mi 'dzin to zhes brjod pa ni gsal ba la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature that depends on that is not apprehended without the apprehension of that.üîΩThe general is stated:

original: mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni spyi'i'o //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni spyi'i'o //
translated: Because it is not apprehended.

original: 'dzin na yang gsal ba ma lus pa 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin na yang gsal ba ma lus pa 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is apprehended, it follows that the entire individual is apprehended.

original: gzhan las ldog pa la ni nyes pa 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa la ni nyes pa 'di mtshungs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The response to the claim that the fault is not the same in the case of the exclusion from other is:

original: gzhan las ldog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The exclusion from other.

original: ji ltar skyon du 'gyur ba med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyon du 'gyur ba med ce na /
translated: How is it that the fault does not arise?üîΩThe response is:

original: phan tshun zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mutual exclusion.

original: gzhan du byed ces bya ba ni rigs mi mthun par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du byed ces bya ba ni rigs mi mthun par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means as a different type.

original: 'o na spyi'i tha snyad ji ltar snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i tha snyad ji ltar snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow is a general convention?‚Äù

original: de don bya ba zhes @91a * //
analyzed: de don bya ba zhes @91a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äôs activity‚Äù is the answer.

original: bya ba'o // gal te gsal ba bzhin du don bya ba yang tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: bya ba'o // gal te gsal ba bzhin du don bya ba yang tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the object‚Äôs activity is not different, like the manifestation,

original: des na ji ltar de'i sgo nas /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de'i sgo nas /
translated: then how can it be that

original: de ltar de tha snyad byed snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de ltar de tha snyad byed snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: one makes a convention in that way?‚Äù

original: du ma nyid ma 'phrigs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: du ma nyid ma 'phrigs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of not understanding multiplicity‚Äù is the answer.

original: mi mtshungs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of dissimilar things‚Äù is the objection.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni spyi'i blo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni spyi'i blo nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means by the cognition of the universal alone.

original: 'di ga las she na mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù is the question. ‚ÄúBecause of the form of similarity‚Äù is the answer.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of the multicolored object.

original: gang gi phyir mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po las de nyid dang / gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa yin no zhes brjod pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po las de nyid dang / gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir dngos po med pa yin no zhes brjod pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the nature of the universal is not described as being the same as or different from the thing, therefore it is said to be a non-thing.

original: rnam par rtog pa gcig pus rtogs par bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan dag tu mngon sum gyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gcig pus rtogs par bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan dag tu mngon sum gyi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: that which is to be understood by a single conceptual cognition is not the object of direct perception as being the same as or different from that.

original: yang na gang gi phyir spyi'i rang bzhin gsal ba dang 'brel pa nyid du mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de dngos po med pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni de'i zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir spyi'i rang bzhin gsal ba dang 'brel pa nyid du mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de dngos po med pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni de'i zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or else, because it is not tenable that the nature of the universal is related to the manifestation, therefore it is said to be a non-thing.

original: rnam par rtog pa gcig pus rtogs par bya ba gsal ba dang 'brel pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gcig pus rtogs par bya ba gsal ba dang 'brel pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: that which is to be understood by a single conceptual cognition is not related to the manifestation, and is not the object of direct perception.

original: dngos por yod pa'i spyi ni 'bras bu 'am gzhan zhig yin grang /
analyzed: dngos por yod pa'i spyi ni 'bras bu 'am gzhan zhig yin grang /
translated: Is the universal that exists as a thing either an effect or something else?

original: re zhig 'bras bu ni ma yin te dus kyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i gsal ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyi du ma nyid yin na spyi ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni de 'bras she na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu ni ma yin te dus kyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i gsal ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyi du ma nyid yin na spyi ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni de 'bras she na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: First, it is not the effect, because if the effect were many due to the difference in time of the manifestation, it would follow that it is not the universal.

original: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal ba bzhin du 'jig par gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal ba bzhin du 'jig par gyur na /
translated: If it were the effect, it would be destroyed like the manifestation, because it is the effect.

original: de yang de ltar 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang de ltar 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: But that is not accepted in that way.

original: de yang 'dod ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not accepted.

original: 'bras bu yang ma yin la rtag pa yang ma yin pa la ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ma yin la rtag pa yang ma yin pa la ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: What contradiction is there in something being neither the effect nor permanent?

original: 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
translated: Destruction is not the mere thing,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the mere thing is not permanent.

original: dngos po nyid ni don bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid la yang 'bras bu nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni don bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid la yang 'bras bu nyid la mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: The mere thing, which is characterized by performing an action, is also pervaded by impermanence in the effect.

original: rtag pa nyid la ni 'gal bas khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la ni 'gal bas khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is pervaded by contradiction in permanence.

original: 'on te nyes pa 'dis 'jig pas 'bras bu ma yin no zhes dogs pa yod pa kun la rag ma las zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa 'dis 'jig pas 'bras bu ma yin no zhes dogs pa yod pa kun la rag ma las zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis na /
translated: But if it is thought that it is not an effect because it is destroyed by this fault, then it is said that it is not a universal because it is not related to the particulars.

original: spyi gsal ba rnams dang ma 'brel pas na /
analyzed: spyi gsal ba rnams dang ma 'brel pas na /
translated: The word ‚Äúkinds‚Äù is used because it is not related to the particulars.

original: nam mkha' @91b bzhin du spyi ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rigs rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' @91b bzhin du spyi ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rigs rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it would not be a universal, like space, because it is not related to the particulars.

original: ma 'brel ba ni gsal ba rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ni gsal ba rnams dang ngo //
translated: It is not related to the particulars.

original: dngos med ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos med ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Non-entity is like the horn of a rabbit, which has no essence.

original: ji ltar mtshungs pa nyid dngos po'i mtshan nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshungs pa nyid dngos po'i mtshan nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is sameness not a characteristic of an entity?

original: rtog pa 'khrul pa'i zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: rtog pa 'khrul pa'i zhes gsungs so ;
translated: It is said that it is a conceptual error.

original: / gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig pus rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig pus rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is to be understood only by a conceptual thought.

original: gal te spyi ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa las tha dad par rtog pa nyid ma yin na ma zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa las tha dad par rtog pa nyid ma yin na ma zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If a universal is not conceived as different from the aspect of a conceptual thought, then the doubt is, ‚ÄúWell then, how is it conceived?‚Äù

original: gsal ba gnyis ka yod na ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gsal ba gnyis ka yod na ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: If both were manifest, there would be two aspects.

original: de gzhan yod na ni rnam pa gsum pa rtogs pa ji ltar bsnyon zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gzhan yod na ni rnam pa gsum pa rtogs pa ji ltar bsnyon zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the other were manifest, how could you deny the cognition of a third aspect?üîΩEven so, it follows that it is the effect.

original: de lta na yang de ni 'bras bur thal lo zhes brjod pa ni de lta na'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni 'bras bur thal lo zhes brjod pa ni de lta na'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then it is just as we have said.üîΩIf it were so,

original: de ltar gyur dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: that is, if it were manifest,

original: du ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnyis la sogs par tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: du ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnyis la sogs par tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: it would be manifold, because it would be different in two aspects and so on.

original: /'on te du ma nyid ni ngo shes pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: /'on te du ma nyid ni ngo shes pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: But if manifoldness is refuted by recognition,

original: dogs pa ni ngo shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni ngo shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the doubt is that recognition is not valid.

original: gsal ba bzhin du 'phel ba'i rnam pa can gyi spyi la yang 'phel ba'i rnam pa can gzhan yod la /
analyzed: gsal ba bzhin du 'phel ba'i rnam pa can gyi spyi la yang 'phel ba'i rnam pa can gzhan yod la /
translated: Even in the case of a universal that has the aspect of increase, like the manifest, there is another universal that has the aspect of increase,

original: de la yang gzhan yod pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni spyi la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan yod pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni spyi la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and because there is another of that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: spyi la spyi ma rtogs na ni gsal ba la yang mi rtogs pas mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi la spyi ma rtogs na ni gsal ba la yang mi rtogs pas mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the universal is not understood in the universal, it is not understood in the particular either.

original: gal te gsal ba la ba lang ba lang zhes ngo shes pa ni spyi sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas ngo shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba la ba lang ba lang zhes ngo shes pa ni spyi sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas ngo shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that the recognition of the particular as a cow establishes the universal, the response is: ‚ÄúRecognition is not a proof of the universal.‚Äù

original: ma nges pa nges pa med pa ni ste 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma nges pa nges pa med pa ni ste 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúUncertain‚Äù means ‚Äúuncertain,‚Äù that is, mistaken.

original: ba lang nyid dang rta nyid la sogs pa'i spyi dag la ni /
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang rta nyid la sogs pa'i spyi dag la ni /
translated: The universal of cow and the universal of horse, etc.

original: spyi gcig gi rgyu mtshan can gyi ngo shes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi gcig gi rgyu mtshan can gyi ngo shes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: are the same in being universals.

original: rnam 'grel las //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las //
translated: The PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika says,

original: brjod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brjod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the result of expression.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs sla ba'i phyir bzhag nas gtan tshigs gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs sla ba'i phyir bzhag nas gtan tshigs gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Having stated this reason, which is easy to understand, another reason is stated:

original: gsal ba zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the particular is destroyed when it perishes.

original: gsal ba dang 'dus pa'i rang bzhin ni de zhig na gnas par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gsal ba dang 'dus pa'i rang bzhin ni de zhig na gnas par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the nature of the particular and the universal remain when it perishes?

original: gnas na yang gsal ba yang gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar @92a * //
analyzed: gnas na yang gsal ba yang gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar @92a * //
translated: If it abides, then clarity would also abide.üîΩHow?

original: ngo bo med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be without a nature?

original: dngos po nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the very entity.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would happen from that?

original: spyi khyab pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spyi khyab pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the pervasion of the general.

original: ci'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does it not exist?

original: dus kyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dus kyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the time.

original: gal te de ltar ma dmigs kyang de ltar yod pa ci ste ma yin zhe na dmigs pa nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar ma dmigs kyang de ltar yod pa ci ste ma yin zhe na dmigs pa nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: If it is not observed in that way, why does it not exist in that way? It is the very observation.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med na'o //
translated: If that does not exist,üîΩif observation does not exist,

original: yod pa ni dmigs pa la gzhan yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa ni dmigs pa la gzhan yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is other than existence and observation.

original: de lta na thug pa med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na thug pa med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: If that is so, there is an infinite regress.

original: yod pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Existence is also like that.

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad de ;
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad de ;
translated: This is merely stated as an assertion.

original: khyed kyi lta ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi lta ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not your view.

original: tshig gi don gsum yod par byed pa ni yod pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: tshig gi don gsum yod par byed pa ni yod pa yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is said that the three meanings of the word exist‚Äù is the response.

original: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúgenerally‚Äù is the response.

original: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is the response.

original: 'o na de ni rang gi ngo bos yod pa kho na yod pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de ni rang gi ngo bos yod pa kho na yod pa yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that it exists only by intrinsic reality,

original: de ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: the response is ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bos yod pa de ni'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos yod pa de ni'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to existence by intrinsic reality.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ma dmigs pas so //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù refers to nonapprehension.

original: yang rang gi ngo bos yod pas yod pa nyid yin pas sun 'byin pa'i phyir bong bu'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang rang gi ngo bos yod pas yod pa nyid yin pas sun 'byin pa'i phyir bong bu'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response ‚Äúdonkey‚Äôs horn‚Äù is the response to the argument that it exists by intrinsic reality.

original: khyed la yang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ni /
analyzed: khyed la yang zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is the response to the qualm.

original: sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
translated: The qualm is that the Buddhist also has the same fault.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is ‚Äúbecause it is causeless.‚Äù

original: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva med pa yin no //
translated: The response ‚Äúso it is‚Äù is that if the absence of a rabbit‚Äôs horns is because it is causeless,

original: de'i tshe spyi yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then a universal would also be nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The response is:

original: de la yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven in that case, . . .‚Äù

original: spyi la yang ngo //
analyzed: spyi la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven‚Äù means ‚Äúin general.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the qualm that the cognitions do not arise without an object is:

original: yul med par ni blo rnams mi skye'o zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul med par ni blo rnams mi skye'o zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe response is:

original: ri bong gi zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ri bong gi zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe horns of a rabbit . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the qualm that the horns of a rabbit and so on do not exist when analyzed is:

original: 'on te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas spyi yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni rnam par dpyad na yod pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas spyi yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThe response is:

original: nges par brtags na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges par brtags na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen definitely examined . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te sgra las byung ba'i blo la snang ba gang yin pa de nyid kyi spyi yin /
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba'i blo la snang ba gang yin pa de nyid kyi spyi yin /
translated: If the universal is that which appears to the cognition that arises from the word,üîΩthen the universal is not a thing, because it is contradictory to apprehend the pervader.

original: de yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yang dngos po ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yang dngos po ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is:üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, . . . ‚Äù

original: gang zhig brda'i stobs kyis snang ba de ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig brda'i stobs kyis snang ba de ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: That which appears by the power of convention is not a thing,

original: dper na gsal bya la sogs pa'i spyi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gsal bya la sogs pa'i spyi bzhin no //
translated: like the universal of the manifest and so on.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi @92b yang brda'i stobs kyis snang ba yin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi @92b yang brda'i stobs kyis snang ba yin no //
translated: The universals of cow-ness and so forth also appear by the power of signs.

original: gal te 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: If you think that this is not certain,

original: dngos po la yang brda'i stobs kyis snang ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: dngos po la yang brda'i stobs kyis snang ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
translated: because it is possible that things also appear by the power of signs,

original: dngos po nyid ni brda'i stobs la mi ltos par snang bas khyab pa de dang 'gal ba yod na mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni brda'i stobs la mi ltos par snang bas khyab pa de dang 'gal ba yod na mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: we say that it is not so, because it is contradictory to the pervasion that things appear without depending on the power of signs.

original: / skabs su bab pa la khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba nyid ston pa ni brda la mi ltos pa de ltar ni snang ba med kyi 'on kyang de la ltos par snang ngo //üîΩgal te brda la ltos pa'i shes pa la yang dngos po med pa kho na la ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas brda byed pa ni zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: / skabs su bab pa la khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba nyid ston pa ni brda la mi ltos pa de ltar ni snang ba med kyi 'on kyang de la ltos par snang ngo // gal te brda la ltos pa'i shes pa la yang dngos po med pa kho na la ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba nas brda byed pa ni zhes gsungs so ;
translated: To show the contradiction with the pervader in the present context, we say that it is not the case that things appear without depending on signs, but rather that they appear in dependence on signs.

original: / gang gi phyir de ltar brda byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir de ltar brda byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that it is not so, because even the cognition that depends on signs does not have a real thing as its object, we say that it is not so, because the object of the cognition that depends on signs is not a real thing.üîΩSince it is not so, the cognition that depends on signs does not have a real thing as its object.

original: 'on kyang snga ma dang phyi ma sgro btags pa kho nas yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma dang phyi ma sgro btags pa kho nas yin /
translated: But the former and latter are only superimpositions.

original: de'i phyir de la ltos pa'i shes pa pa yang dngos po med par sgro btags pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la ltos pa'i shes pa pa yang dngos po med par sgro btags pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that depends on it is not only a superimposition of a non-existent entity.

original: 'on te yang snga ma dang phyi ma sgro btags pa med kyang brda byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang snga ma dang phyi ma sgro btags pa med kyang brda byed pa yin te /
translated: But if the former and latter are not superimpositions, then the signifier is

original: des na de la ltos pa'i rtogs pa ni dngos po la yang 'gyur ba yin no zhes dogs na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na de la ltos pa'i rtogs pa ni dngos po la yang 'gyur ba yin no zhes dogs na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one suspects that the cognition that depends on it is also an entity, then the verse says, in this way.

original: gal te nye ba tsam la brten nas kyang byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe de'i mthar thug pa nyid kyis tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba des na sgra las don rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nye ba tsam la brten nas kyang byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe de'i mthar thug pa nyid kyis tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur ba des na sgra las don rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is based on mere proximity, then at the time of convention, it would follow that it reaches the end of that, and therefore the meaning would not be understood from the word.

original: gal te brda ni rjes su 'gro ba med kyang sgra'i stobs kho nas don rtogs so snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te brda ni rjes su 'gro ba med kyang sgra'i stobs kho nas don rtogs so snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: If one suspects that even without following the convention, the meaning is understood only by the power of the word,

original: sgra'i mthu nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mthu nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said, by the power of the word alone.

original: brda'i rjes su 'gro ba med par sgra las don rtogs pa mi srid do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: brda'i rjes su 'gro ba med par sgra las don rtogs pa mi srid do zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
