translated: It is impossible to understand the meaning from the word without following the convention.üîΩThe answer is:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were to exist.‚Äù

original: gal te spyi'i shes pa brda la ltos pa yin no zhes ga las rtogs zhes dogs pa na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i shes pa brda la ltos pa yin no zhes ga las rtogs zhes dogs pa na /
translated: If it is the case that the cognition of the universal depends on the convention, how do you understand this?üîΩThe answer is:

original: brda med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brda med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Without the convention.

original: bhid rdi dang a'ad aee zhes bya ba ltar 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i brda la yang ngo //
analyzed: bhid rdi dang a'ad aee zhes bya ba ltar 'di ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i brda la yang ngo //
translated: Just as in the case of the words ‚Äúbird‚Äù and ‚Äúhouse,‚Äù so too in the case of the convention ‚Äúthis is a cow.‚Äù

original: 'di ni ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di ni ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba yin no zhes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: The meaning is that this is what is to be expressed by the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: brda med par ni gang du yang sgra rjod byed nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brda med par ni gang du yang sgra rjod byed nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, without the convention, the word is not expressive anywhere.

original: dngos gnyis mthong la zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel nye bar bkod pa kho nar 'chad pa ni sgra med par yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos gnyis mthong la zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel nye bar bkod pa kho nar 'chad pa ni sgra med par yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the line ‚ÄúOne sees two things‚Äù explains that the word ‚Äúwithout‚Äù refers to the commentary itself.

original: mthong ba'i ba lang gi gsal ba las ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan ni gsal ba gzhan te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i ba lang gi gsal ba las ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan ni gsal ba gzhan te /
translated: A cow-universal that is different from the cow-particular that is seen is a different particular.

original: de mthong ba las ni'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba las ni'o //
translated: The meaning is that one sees that.

original: sgra med par yang zhes @93a * //
analyzed: sgra med par yang zhes @93a * //
translated: Also without sound means that in general, the cognition would occur without depending on a convention.

original: bya bar ni brda la mi ltos par spyir blor 'gyur ro zhe na lan der yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩgsal ba gzhan mthong bar yang ngo //
analyzed: bya bar ni brda la mi ltos par spyir blor 'gyur ro zhe na lan der yang zhes bya ba ste / gsal ba gzhan mthong bar yang ngo //
translated: The response to that is also.

original: de nyid ni gsal ba gzhan nyid de brda yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni gsal ba gzhan nyid de brda yin no //
translated: Also when another manifestation is seen, that is, another manifestation that is a convention.

original: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni spyi la tha snyad do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni spyi la tha snyad do //
translated: The nature of that is the convention for the universal.üîΩThe nature of that refers to the universal.

original: dngos por 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni de'i tha snyad kyi dngos po ste de la'o //
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni de'i tha snyad kyi dngos po ste de la'o //
translated: That which has the nature of becoming a thing is the basis of the convention for that, and it is for that.

original: de lta na ni 'o na brda la mi ltos so zhes bya bar brjod pa ni rigs so zhes dogs pa bsu nas brda smos pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na brda la mi ltos so zhes bya bar brjod pa ni rigs so zhes dogs pa bsu nas brda smos pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is so, then it is reasonable to say it does not depend on a convention, anticipating that qualm, he says the convention.

original: rtags la yang ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis dngos po'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa'o ;
analyzed: rtags la yang ltos pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis dngos po'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i shes pa'o ;
translated: It does not depend on a sign either means that it is a cognition produced by the power of the thing itself.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtags kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: rtags kyang zhes smos te /
translated: He says also a sign.

original: sgra 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
analyzed: sgra 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
translated: It is not only sound.

original: ci ltar ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rigs rtags dang brda la sogs pas bskyed pa'i shes pa la rtogs par bya ba la yin pa de bzhin du bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kyang yin no zhes brjod pa ni de bzhin du gsal bya la sogs
analyzed: ci ltar ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rigs rtags dang brda la sogs pas bskyed pa'i shes pa la rtogs par bya ba la yin pa de bzhin du bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kyang yin no zhes brjod pa ni de bzhin du gsal bya la sogs
translated: Just as the cognition produced by the signs of the class of a cow, etc., and by the name, etc., is with regard to the object to be understood, in the same way, the class of a Brahmin, etc., is also.

original: pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is called ‚Äúthe same with regard to the manifestation, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te brda dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum ni rigs kyis grub par byed pa ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: gal te brda dang lhan cig pa'i mngon sum ni rigs kyis grub par byed pa ma yin pa des na /
translated: If direct perception together with the name does not establish the class, then it is not the case that the object does not exist.

original: dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni bram ze la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni bram ze la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the anticipation of an objection, ‚Äúwith regard to the Brahmin, etc.‚Äù

original: mngon sum brda la ltos pa'i phyir na de la ltos pa med pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum brda la ltos pa'i phyir na de la ltos pa med pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not said that direct perception is without regard to it because it depends on the name.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pas dngos po yul can ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa ni brda tsam la ltos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pas dngos po yul can ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa ni brda tsam la ltos pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the object is not a real entity because of the observation of a pervader that is incompatible is ‚Äúbecause it depends on the mere name.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir na dmus long brgyud ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir na dmus long brgyud ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The reply to the objection that it is not so because it is the direct cause of the simultaneous is:

original: lhan cig byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe simultaneous cause‚Äù

original: bzung ba zhe na zhes bya ba ni des na'o //
analyzed: bzung ba zhe na zhes bya ba ni des na'o //
translated: If it is grasped, then.

original: ma nges na yang nye bar bstan pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ma nges na yang nye bar bstan pa mi 'thad de /
translated: If it is not ascertained, the demonstration is not tenable.

original: des na rang nyid med pa'i phyir don med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na rang nyid med pa'i phyir don med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement that it is meaningless because it does not exist by itself is:

original: mngon sum gyis ma bzung na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma bzung na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is not grasped by direct perception.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ni mi nus pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ni mi nus pa zhe na /
translated: How is it not possible?

original: mthong ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIn the case of seeing.‚Äù

original: nus pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: nus pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: The possibility is the valid cognition.

original: 'di gzhan gyis kyang 'dod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis kyang 'dod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that this is also accepted by others is:

original: de skad du yang zhes bya ba ste ri khrod rjes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang zhes bya ba ste ri khrod rjes bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThus.‚Äù This is the explanation of the forest-dweller.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po las 'das pa dag la nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po las 'das pa dag la nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the demonstration of the suprasensible.

original: skyes bu blos @93b bskyed pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu blos @93b bskyed pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The production of a person by the mind is only invalid cognition.

original: bshad zin pa'i rtsod pa nyid lhag pa brjod pa'i don du dgod pa ni /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i rtsod pa nyid lhag pa brjod pa'i don du dgod pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to further elaborate the previously mentioned argument.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is argued:üîΩ‚ÄúBrahmanhood is not a caste.‚Äù

original: bram ze nyid ni rigs ni mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na de ni de ltar zhes gsungs te bram ze nyid de ni brda med par btags pa'i phyir ro ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bram ze nyid ni rigs ni mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ji ltar zhe na de ni de ltar zhes gsungs te bram ze nyid de ni brda med par btags pa'i phyir ro ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: How is that? It is said: ‚ÄúIt is not like that.‚Äù Brahmanhood is a designation without a sign. Why is that?

original: ba lang nyid bzhin du bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs ni gsal bas gsal bar byed par ma mthong gi /'on kyang nye bar bstan pa kho nas yin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid bzhin du bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs ni gsal bas gsal bar byed par ma mthong gi /'on kyang nye bar bstan pa kho nas yin no //
translated: The caste of Brahman, etc. is not seen to be manifested by the manifestation of the individual, like the caste of a cow, but rather by mere indication.

original: de'i gsal byed gsal snang ba yin par ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: de'i gsal byed gsal snang ba yin par ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it understood that the manifestation of the individual is the manifestation of that?

original: ba lang nyid la ni gsal te 'di ba lang ma yin no zhes dag gzhan brjod pa de'i tshe ba lang nyid 'dir 'ga' zhig the tshom 'gyur ram ci ste mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la ni gsal te 'di ba lang ma yin no zhes dag gzhan brjod pa de'i tshe ba lang nyid 'dir 'ga' zhig the tshom 'gyur ram ci ste mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: When it is said that the caste of a cow is manifested, and it is said that this is not a cow, then at that time, is there any doubt about the caste of a cow? Of course not.

original: des 'di'i gsal bar byed pa ni gsal ba yin no zhes rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des 'di'i gsal bar byed pa ni gsal ba yin no zhes rtogs pa yin no //
translated: It is understood that the manifestation of that is the manifestation of the individual.

original: bram ze nyid la ni rtogs pa 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bram ze nyid la ni rtogs pa 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This understanding does not exist even for the brahmin himself.

original: bram ze nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bram ze nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúThis understanding does not exist even for the brahmin himself.‚Äù

original: gzhan las kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni bya las der ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni bya las der ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also not ascertained from another. This is stated in the line ‚ÄúIn that case, the bird.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyi smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi smos te /
translated: It is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe other.‚Äù

original: dmangs rigs la sogs pas so //üîΩbram ze la sogs pa'i rigs bzhin du gsal bya la sogs pa'i rigs la yang nye bar bstan pa kho na gsal byed yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dmangs rigs la sogs pas so // bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs bzhin du gsal bya la sogs pa'i rigs la yang nye bar bstan pa kho na gsal byed yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The other is the ≈õ≈´dra and so on.

original: bstan pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the brahmin and so on are the types, the types of the manifest and so on are also just the manifest and so on. This is stated in the line ‚ÄúWithout teaching.‚Äù

original: gsal ba ni mngon par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni mngon par gsal ba'o //
translated: Manifest means clearly manifest.

original: 'di snyam du gsal bya la sogs pa'i rigs ni rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir de nyid kyis gsal ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gsal bya la sogs pa'i rigs ni rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir de nyid kyis gsal ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that the types of the manifest and so on are manifest by themselves because they do not have their own nature, the response to this is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf you think.‚Äù

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo med na'o //
translated: If they do not exist, if they do not have their own nature,

original: lan ni ba lang dang bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs la yang de ci ste 'dod /
analyzed: lan ni ba lang dang bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs la yang de ci ste 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the class of cow, Brahmin, etc. is also like that?

original: sgra gcig 'jug par bya ba'i don du'o zhe na /
analyzed: sgra gcig 'jug par bya ba'i don du'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is for the sake of applying a single term,

original: 'o na gsal bya la sogs pa la sgra gcig 'jug / sgra gcig gis brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rigs yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gsal bya la sogs pa la sgra gcig 'jug / sgra gcig gis brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rigs yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then the class is the nature that is the object of expression by a single term, because it is the object of a single term, such as ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ji ltar dbyangs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ji ltar dbyangs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then how is it that the term ‚Äúvowel‚Äù and so on is applied to the individual vowels?

original: gal te khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba mtha' yas pas rigs gcig med pas de dag sgra gcig ji ltar sbyor te khyad par rnams ni mtha' yas bas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lugs yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni @94a *
analyzed: gal te khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba mtha' yas pas rigs gcig med pas de dag sgra gcig ji ltar sbyor te khyad par rnams ni mtha' yas bas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lugs yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni @94a *
translated: If you say that because there are infinitely many manifestations such as variegated color, there is no single class, and therefore how can a single term be applied to them, since the differences are infinite, this is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: // ba lang gi nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: // ba lang gi nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúbecause of the nature of the class.‚Äù

original: der ni gsal ba mtha' yas pa der ro //
analyzed: der ni gsal ba mtha' yas pa der ro //
translated: There means in the case of infinitely many manifestations.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Also means the response.

original: ji ltar mtha' yas snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtha' yas snyam na /
translated: How are they infinite?

original: gong du spong sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gong du spong sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: The above verse says ‚Äúabandonment, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIf you think that even without grasping a convention, one can make a convention by connecting a particular thing with a word, such as ‚Äúthis is that,‚Äù then this is the same in the case of a multicolored object, etc.

original: ci ste brda ma bzung bas kyang gsal bya la sogs pa la de nyid ni 'di'o zhes mtshams sbyor ba las brda byed pa yin no snyam du dogs na 'di ni khra bo la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni ngo shes pa las zhes
analyzed: ci ste brda ma bzung bas kyang gsal bya la sogs pa la de nyid ni 'di'o zhes mtshams sbyor ba las brda byed pa yin no snyam du dogs na 'di ni khra bo la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni ngo shes pa las zhes
translated: This is what is said in the phrase ‚Äúbecause of recognition.‚Äù

original: bya ba'o // gang gi sgra gcig gi brjod bya nyid la gtogs par bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'o // gang gi sgra gcig gi brjod bya nyid la gtogs par bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the status of being a Brahmin, etc., does not exist in the referent of a single word.

original: khra bo la sogs don rnams kyi nye ba'o //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs don rnams kyi nye ba'o //
translated: The referents of words such as ‚Äúmulticolored‚Äù are close.

original: gal te rigs med sgra dang 'dzin pa gcig dang ldan pa ji ltar srid snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rigs med sgra dang 'dzin pa gcig dang ldan pa ji ltar srid snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is impossible for a single word to have a referent that is not a universal,

original: de ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is ‚Äúno.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ba lang nyid rgyu mtshan gzhan med kyang de ltar mthong ba las khra bo la sogs pa nyid la yod pa de bzhin du der 'dzin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang nyid rgyu mtshan gzhan med kyang de ltar mthong ba las khra bo la sogs pa nyid la yod pa de bzhin du der 'dzin pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as cowness is seen in a multicolored cow, etc., even though there is no other reason, in the same way, the cognition of that is also like that.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nyid la gzugs kyi shes pa rgyu mtshan gzhan med par ngo bo nyid kyi yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa nyid la gzugs kyi shes pa rgyu mtshan gzhan med par ngo bo nyid kyi yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, the eye, etc. themselves, without any other reason, are the cause of the cognition of form, but not the ear, etc.

original: rna ba la sogs pa la ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhes dper bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa la ni ma yin pa bzhin no zhes dper bya'o //
translated: This is the example.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams la ni nye ba yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams la ni nye ba yod pa kho na ste /
translated: But the eye, etc. do have a proximate cause,

original: lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cooperating cause.

original: khra bo la sogs pa la ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩlhan cig byed pa rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa la ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni / lhan cig byed pa rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But not the variegated, etc.üîΩThe reply to the objection is: ‚ÄúEven in the case of the variegated, etc., there is a single cognition from the cooperating cause, just as in the case of the eye, etc. So what is the use of the whole?‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa rnams la yang lhan cig byed pa nyid las blo gcig 'jug pa yin pas spyis ci zhig bya zhes lan 'debs pa ni dngos po gnyis mthong ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa rnams la yang lhan cig byed pa nyid las blo gcig 'jug pa yin pas spyis ci zhig bya zhes lan 'debs pa ni dngos po gnyis mthong ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúEven in the case of seeing two things, there is a single cognition.‚Äù

original: blo yang yin la gcig kyang yin pa ste /
analyzed: blo yang yin la gcig kyang yin pa ste /
translated: The cognition is one, and it is also a cognition.

original: rigs med par yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs med par yang 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: It would not be a universal.

original: rigs med na blo gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rigs med na blo gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: If there is no universal, how can there be a single cognition?

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ces smras te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid ces smras te /
translated: The response to this is: ‚Äúbecause of the very same aspect.‚Äù

original: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin no ;
analyzed: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin no ;
translated: The nature of the object of cognition.

original: / ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: / ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation of the objection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gzhal bya zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gzhal bya zhes smos so //
translated: Why? Because of the object of cognition.

original: blo gcig pa las ma gtogs par ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid la dmigs te /
analyzed: blo gcig pa las ma gtogs par ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid la dmigs te /
translated: Apart from a single cognition, there is no observation of the very same aspect.

original: de bas na de ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na de ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist at all. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa dpe yin no zhes @94b brjod pa ni de ni zhes gsungs te blo gcig bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa dpe yin no zhes @94b brjod pa ni de ni zhes gsungs te blo gcig bskyed pa'o //
translated: For this very reason, the example is the eye, etc. This is stated by ‚Äúthat.‚Äù A single cognition is produced.

original: 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa la yang blo gcig skyed par byed pa nyid kyi spyi yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa la yang blo gcig skyed par byed pa nyid kyi spyi yod pa kho na'o //
translated: One might think that the eye, etc. also have a universal that produces a single cognition.

original: des na med par bsgrub pa la de dag dpe nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de dag la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na med par bsgrub pa la de dag dpe nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de dag la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how can they be examples in the proof of nonexistence? The response to this is: ‚ÄúEven in those.‚Äù

original: skyed par byed ba nyid kyang blo gcig skyed pa las gzhan ni med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni khra bo la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed ba nyid kyang blo gcig skyed pa las gzhan ni med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni khra bo la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply that the only production of a single cognition is the production of a cognition is ‚ÄúEven in the case of a multicolored object.‚Äù

original: blo gcig bskyed pa nyid spyi yin no snyam par dogs pa ni gal te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo gcig bskyed pa nyid spyi yin no snyam par dogs pa ni gal te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that the production of a single cognition is a universal is ‚ÄúIf that is so . . .‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni skyed byed kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i spyi med na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni skyed byed kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i spyi med na'o //
translated: The reply that it is not so, that is, that there is no universal that is the characteristic of a producer, is ‚ÄúOtherwise . . .‚Äù

original: rigs kyi stobs kyis blo nges kyang de nyid ga las nges zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs kyis blo nges kyang de nyid ga las nges zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The reply that a cognition is ascertained by the power of a universal, but that it is not ascertained by that is ‚ÄúIf that is so . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na rigs kyang bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na rigs kyang bya ba'o //
translated: The reply that a universal is also an activity is ‚ÄúWell then, a universal is also an activity.‚Äù

original: rigs gzhan las zhes bya bar khas len na ni /
analyzed: rigs gzhan las zhes bya bar khas len na ni /
translated: The reply that if one accepts that it is from another universal is ‚ÄúIf one accepts that it is from another universal . . .‚Äù

original: thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste rigs la'o //
analyzed: thug pa med do zhes brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste rigs la'o //
translated: The statement that there is an infinite regress is ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: rnam par 'byed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i gsal bas gsal bar byed pa nyid dang rten du byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par byed pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i gsal bas gsal bar byed pa nyid dang rten du byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement that it is the basis of the ascertainment of a universal is ‚ÄúIt is the basis of the ascertainment of a universal.‚Äù

original: gsal ba'i rgyu ni nus pa nyid las rnam par dbye ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa med pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu ni nus pa nyid las rnam par dbye ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa med pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of manifestation is the potency itself, which is distinguished from the other causes. Therefore, there is no infinite regress.üîΩTo anticipate the objection, he says, ‚ÄúOr, if you say that the cognition of difference is not to be refuted. . . . ‚Äù

original: de lta yin na rigs don med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni de lta na yang 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na rigs don med do zhes lan 'debs pa ni de lta na yang 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúIn that case, the universal is meaningless. . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te tha dad pa rnams kyi blo gcig bskyed pa nyid du bzlog par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa rnams kyi blo gcig bskyed pa nyid du bzlog par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the cognition of difference is not to be refuted because it generates a single cognition,

original: 'on kyang gcig snang ba yin no zhes brjod do snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig snang ba yin no zhes brjod do snyam du dogs na /
translated: but rather that a single thing appears,

original: mig la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the eye and so on would also be a universal.

original: ji ltar zhe na gang gi phyir rnam pa 'gas kyang sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum la snang ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gang gi phyir rnam pa 'gas kyang sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum la snang ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because, in some way, it does not appear in perception, like blue and so on.

original: gal te mi snang ba'i phyir spyi med na /
analyzed: gal te mi snang ba'i phyir spyi med na /
translated: If you say that the universal does not exist because it does not appear,

original: mig la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the eye and so on would also be nonexistent.

original: dbang po ni gzugs dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir na dbang po las 'das pa thob pa la snang bar 'gyur ro zhes srid par ston pa ni ga te dbang po rnams kyi lta ba po zhig yod na /
analyzed: dbang po ni gzugs dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir na dbang po las 'das pa thob pa la snang bar 'gyur ro zhes srid par ston pa ni ga te dbang po rnams kyi lta ba po zhig yod na /
translated: Since the sense faculties are material, it is possible that one would obtain the sense faculties that transcend the visible.

original: de'i tshe de'i lus ni snang ba yin te gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i lus ni snang ba yin te gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were a seer, then his body would be visible, because it would be material.

original: rigs rnams ni gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs rnams ni gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But the universals do not have form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yan 'gar ba gsal ba ni 'dzin pa dang bral ba rnams mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan 'gar ba gsal ba ni 'dzin pa dang bral ba rnams mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the clear manifestation of the object is not seen by those who are without grasping.

original: @95a * // ci ste de ltar mthong ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: @95a * // ci ste de ltar mthong ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: But if that is so, then the clear manifestation of the object does exist.

original: gsal ba 'dzin pa'i tshe na 'ang gsal ba de'i sgra dngos po de las gzhan rigs kyi rang bzhin ni snang ba med do //
analyzed: gsal ba 'dzin pa'i tshe na 'ang gsal ba de'i sgra dngos po de las gzhan rigs kyi rang bzhin ni snang ba med do //
translated: When the clear manifestation is grasped, the sound of that clear manifestation and the universal that is the nature of that object are not visible.

original: mi dmigs pa ma grub par brjod pa ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ma grub par brjod pa ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to the statement that nonapprehension is not established is ‚Äúbecause of the result.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa yang thams cad du rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir spyi yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni thams cad du gcig pa'i 'brel pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang thams cad du rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir spyi yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni thams cad du gcig pa'i 'brel pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated: ‚ÄúBut the relation is a universal, because it is the same in all cases.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de'i de ma thag tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de'i de ma thag tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated: ‚ÄúImmediately after that.‚Äù

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa la grub pa nyid spangs pa'i don du mi snang yang nus ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa la grub pa nyid spangs pa'i don du mi snang yang nus ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the possibility of non-apprehension is rejected in order to avoid the absurd conclusion that there would be no cognition of the object.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po la'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the sense faculty.

original: dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe yang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni 'bras bu ldog pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe yang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni 'bras bu ldog pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example, ‚Äúlike the sense faculty,‚Äù is not established. This is stated: ‚ÄúBecause the effect is not reversed.‚Äù

original: lus kyi ni dbye ba zhes bya bas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: lus kyi ni dbye ba zhes bya bas ni gsum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body‚Äôs‚Äù refers to the three.

original: mig la sogs pa bag chags kyi khyad par yin pa'i lugs brjod pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bag chags kyi khyad par yin pa'i lugs brjod pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the theory that the eye, etc. are particularities of vƒÅsanƒÅ is: ‚ÄúThat which.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar lugs tha dad pa yin pa de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar lugs tha dad pa yin pa de'i phyir na'o //
translated: Because that is the case, the theory is different.

original: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po rjes su dpog pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni dbang po rjes su dpog pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of that‚Äù means by means of the inference of the sense faculty.

original: gal te dbang po rjes su dpag pas ma grub na 'o na de'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rjes su dpag pas ma grub na 'o na de'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If the sense faculty is not established by inference, then what is the proof of it?

original: gzugs dang ldan pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe fact that it possesses form‚Äù is the proof.

original: / lung yin te zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / lung yin te zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe scripture‚Äù means that there is no inference.

original: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni lung las grub pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni lung las grub pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa nyid na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù means if the fact that it possesses form is established by scripture.

original: rigs rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ni spyi ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rigs rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ni spyi ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe universals are not‚Äù means that the explanation is not like that.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no ;
translated: It does not possess form.

original: / ji lta zhe na 'ba' zhig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / ji lta zhe na 'ba' zhig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is that? It is said, ‚Äúthe bare.‚Äù

original: spyi 'ba' zhig mi mthong ba de de'i rang bzhin nyid las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig mi mthong ba de de'i rang bzhin nyid las nyams par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If the bare universal is not seen, it is said that it loses its nature.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the yogi

original: de'i ni blo'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni blo'i'o //
translated: is the cognition of that.

original: 'di ni spyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi'o //
translated: This is the general statement.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù is the response.

original: rnal 'byor pa bzhin du khyed kyis kyang spyi mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa bzhin du khyed kyis kyang spyi mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú Just like the yogi, you would also perceive the universal.‚Äù

original: bdag gis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú I do not‚Äù is the response.

original: spyi'i 'ba' zhig mi mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan du gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyi'i 'ba' zhig mi mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan du gzhan gyi 'dod pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The reason why one does not perceive the universal alone is stated in the opponent‚Äôs assertion:

original: gal te spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If the universal . . .‚Äù

original: gzugs ni snang ba med kyang dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzugs ni snang ba med kyang dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚Äú Form is perceived even when it is not manifest,

original: gsal ba med par ni spyi dmigs pa med pa @95b ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gsal ba med par ni spyi dmigs pa med pa @95b ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: but the universal is not perceived when it is not manifest.‚Äù

original: de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That is also unacceptable‚Äù is the response.

original: tha dad kyang yul gcig pa'i phyir tha dad pa mi dmigs so zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad kyang yul gcig pa'i phyir tha dad pa mi dmigs so zhes smras pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Even though they are different, they are not perceived as different because they have the same object.‚Äù

original: 'on te yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú But if they have the same object . . .‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang dang yul gcig pa de ni de dang tha dad par dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi 'dod pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni gzugs dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang yul gcig pa de ni de dang tha dad par dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi 'dod pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni gzugs dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Whatever has the same object as something is not perceived as different from it‚Äù is your assertion. The response to this is ‚ÄúForm and the universal of form . . .‚Äù

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa yang yul gcig pa'i phyir tha dad dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig ma 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa yang yul gcig pa'i phyir tha dad dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig ma 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: Also, form, taste, etc. would not be perceived separately because they have the same object.

original: des na 'di ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'di ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this is indeterminate.

original: shin tu 'dres pa na gang zhig gang dang yul gcig pa zhes khyad par du byed pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu 'dres pa na gang zhig gang dang yul gcig pa zhes khyad par du byed pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: If they are thoroughly mixed, it is not indeterminate because it is distinguished by the phrase ‚Äúthat which is the same object as that.‚Äù

original: de rnams ni zhes bya ba ste gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams ni zhes bya ba ste gzugs la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to form, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni spyi dang gsal ba gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni spyi dang gsal ba gnyis la'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to both universals and particulars.

original: shin tu zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú Thoroughly‚Äù is the reply.

original: rang bzhin 'dres pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'dres pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the mixture?

original: ci ga rang bzhin 'dres par gyur tam de ma 'dres pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ga rang bzhin 'dres par gyur tam de ma 'dres pa nyid do //
translated: Is the nature of the mixture a mixture or is it not a mixture?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'dres par 'gyur na ni spyi gang bu las tha mi dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'dres par 'gyur na ni spyi gang bu las tha mi dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the mixture were a mixture, then the universal would not be different from the particular.

original: ci ltar zhe na gang gi phyir 'dres par 'gyur na ni spyi gang phyir rang bzhin te ngo bo gang yin pa ni tha dad pa med pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gang gi phyir 'dres par 'gyur na ni spyi gang phyir rang bzhin te ngo bo gang yin pa ni tha dad pa med pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: How so? Because if they were mixed, then any universal would be the same as any other, since they would have no different natures, i.e., no different essences.

original: 'dres pas tha dad par mi rtogs na ni spyi med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dres pas tha dad par mi rtogs na ni spyi med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not perceived as different because they were mixed, then it would follow that there would be no universals.

original: des na khyad par med pa nyid du yul gcig pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu yin pas da ni de las dngos po nyid kyang ma nges pa nyid du yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa nyid du yul gcig pa'i gtan tshigs rgyu yin pas da ni de las dngos po nyid kyang ma nges pa nyid du yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the reason that they are not different is that they have the same object. But now, in order to show that even that is not ascertained, he says,

original: rang bzhin gzhan phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of being different from their natures.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa yang yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa yang yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: This reason is also unestablished, because

original: rang bzhin las ni gzhan 'gyur bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni gzhan 'gyur bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthere is no difference from their natures.‚Äù

original: yul tsam ma grub pa ni shin tu gsal bar de'i khyad par ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul tsam ma grub pa ni shin tu gsal bar de'i khyad par ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The unestablished object is very clearly stated in the words ‚Äútheir difference is not established.‚Äù

original: dngos po las tha dad par zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po las tha dad par zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom things‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: yul tha dad pa yin du zin kyang de lta na yang de tha dad pa ni 'dir ma grub po zhes gsungs so //üîΩgal te dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa yin du zin kyang de lta na yang de tha dad pa ni 'dir ma grub po zhes gsungs so // gal te dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if the objects are different, still, in this case, the difference is not established.üîΩIf it is said, ‚ÄúHow can there be another object?‚Äù

original: yul gzhan ga la yod ces gang brjod pa ni de 'thad pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te yul gyi dbye bas spyi la sogs pa yul can dang / yul dag tha dad pa yin no //üîΩyul ni dngos po las tha dad pa @96a * //
analyzed: yul gzhan ga la yod ces gang brjod pa ni de 'thad pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te yul gyi dbye bas spyi la sogs pa yul can dang / yul dag tha dad pa yin no // yul ni dngos po las tha dad pa @96a * //
translated: The response to this is, ‚ÄúIf the object is different from the thing, then the object is something other than the thing.‚Äù

original: gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object is something other than the thing.

original: de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: In that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i dbye ba ga las yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ga las yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is, ‚ÄúHow can there be a difference in that?‚Äù

original: des na yul gcig pa nyid ni sgrub byed mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na yul gcig pa nyid ni sgrub byed mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not possible to establish that the objects are the same.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtsa bas 'phangs pa'i don brjod pa ni ;
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtsa bas 'phangs pa'i don brjod pa ni ;
translated: The meaning suggested by the root text is stated in the phrase, ‚ÄúFor that reason . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúbecause . . .‚Äù

original: gcig gi blo ni gsal ba rnams la yin no zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gcig gi blo ni gsal ba rnams la yin no zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúthe cognition of one . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro spyi tsam gyi don bya ba lta zhig ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro spyi tsam gyi don bya ba lta zhig ste /
translated: Therefore, the mere general meaning of the term is the object of the action.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang gzhan pa'i shes pa tsam gyi don bya ba la yang spyi de rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang gzhan pa'i shes pa tsam gyi don bya ba la yang spyi de rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a universal is not suitable even for the mere purpose of an action that is a mere object of a conceptual consciousness or another consciousness.

original: de ltar gyur pas ci grub ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pas ci grub ce na /
translated: What is established by that?

original: de mi rung phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de mi rung phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is not suitable.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang ji ltar de ltar dngos po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar de ltar dngos po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Even so, how is it not a thing?

original: gang gi phyir mi rung ba nyid nus pa thams cad brjod pa dang bral ba de ni dngos med mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rung ba nyid nus pa thams cad brjod pa dang bral ba de ni dngos med mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Because that which is not suitable is devoid of all ability, that is the definition of a nonthing.

original: de lta bas na mi rung ba nyid kyis na de ni nye bar brjod pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi rung ba nyid kyis na de ni nye bar brjod pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, because it is not suitable, it is devoid of expression.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin yang de shes pa tsam gyi don bya ba byed pa yang ci mi rung bar go ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin yang de shes pa tsam gyi don bya ba byed pa yang ci mi rung bar go ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it does not appear by way of its own nature, why is it not suitable to posit that it performs the function of being the mere object of a consciousness?

original: gang dang gang zhes bya ba shes pa las tha dad pa shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen nam bdag po'i rkyen zhig tu 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes bya ba shes pa las tha dad pa shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni dmigs pa'i rkyen nam bdag po'i rkyen zhig tu 'gyur ba /
translated: What is different from the consciousness of that and that would be the objective condition or the dominant condition.

original: re zhig bzung bar mngon par 'dod pa rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: re zhig bzung bar mngon par 'dod pa rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin pa de ni /
translated: First, that which is not the appearance of its own entity, which is asserted to be the object of apprehension,

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: is not the objective condition. Why is that?

original: rang gi rnam pa zhes pa smos so //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa zhes pa smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of its own aspect.‚Äù

original: bdag po'i rkyen nyid kyang dogs pa bsu nas smos pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen nyid kyang dogs pa bsu nas smos pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The dominant condition is also not that, as is said in the line ‚Äúit is not the dominant condition.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni ga la zhes pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni ga la zhes pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de nyid yin te /
translated: The dominant condition is not that, because it is the cause that is the basis of the arising of the effect.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the eye and so on.

original: shes pa spyi ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa spyi ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The general consciousness does not follow the presence and absence of that.

original: des na gnyis ka ltar yang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir na rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na gnyis ka ltar yang rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir na rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, since neither is a cause, it is not suitable.

original: de ni dngos po ma yin te brjod bya yin pa'i phyir dang / de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung ba'i phyir na spyir mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni dngos po ma yin te brjod bya yin pa'i phyir dang / de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa tsam gyi don byed par yang mi rung ba'i phyir na spyir mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is not a thing because it is an object of expression, because it is not an object of expression as the same or different, and because it is not suitable as the object of mere cognition.

original: dngos po med par ji skad brjod pa de las bzlog pa gang yin pa rang gi ngo bos snang ba dang @96b brjod par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po med par ji skad brjod pa de las bzlog pa gang yin pa rang gi ngo bos snang ba dang @96b brjod par bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni / rang gi mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The opposite of what was said about non-things, namely that they appear by their own nature, are objects of expression, and are not objects of expression, etc.,üîΩis the definition of particularities.

original: ji skad brjod pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What was said about particularity is that it is a definition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: If is a dispute.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: No is the answer.

original: rang dga' nyid spong ba ci bya ba nyid dang byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dga' nyid spong ba ci bya ba nyid dang byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the use of abandoning one‚Äôs own pleasure?

original: rtogs pa tha dad pa yin yang rang gi rang bzhin kho na'i mtshan nyid du rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa tha dad pa yin yang rang gi rang bzhin kho na'i mtshan nyid du rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Although there is a difference in the understanding of the word ‚ÄúsvabhƒÅva,‚Äù it is only the nature of a thing that is its definition, not anything else.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: ji ltar gzhan mtshon snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan mtshon snyam na /
translated: How is it that it is the definition of something else?

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te thams cad du rang gi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad du rang gi rang bzhin nyid mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: If the nature of a thing is its definition,

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: how can it be the definition of a universal?

original: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It cannot be, is the meaning.

original: gal te rang bzhin mtshan nyid yin no /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin mtshan nyid yin no /
translated: If the nature of a thing is its definition,üîΩhow can it be the definition of a universal?

original: ji ltar spyi mtshan nyid ma yin snyam na gsal ba ma khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar spyi mtshan nyid ma yin snyam na gsal ba ma khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: It is said that it is not, because the manifestation is not pervasive.

original: khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir na rang gi rang bzhin spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba khyab par byed pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir na rang gi rang bzhin spyi'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because variegated things, etc., are not pervasive, their nature is not the definition of a universal.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object of desire, because it appears to thought.

original: 'o na de ltar de spyi yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar de spyi yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut how can that be a universal?‚Äù

original: tha snyad las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tha snyad las zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom the conventional.‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba med par 'jug pa las de ltar zhes bya bas spyi nyid du brjod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med par 'jug pa las de ltar zhes bya bas spyi nyid du brjod pa yin /
translated: Because it is engaged in without differentiation, it is said to be a universal.

original: gal te rnam par dbye ba med par 'jug pa la yang ji ltar te gsal ba du ma'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te rnam par dbye ba med par 'jug pa la yang ji ltar te gsal ba du ma'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBut how can that be engaged in without differentiation?‚Äù He says, ‚Äúin many particulars.‚Äù

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la yang rgyu mtshan ci yod snyam na de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la yang rgyu mtshan ci yod snyam na de las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: What is the reason for the superimposition of the nature of the particulars? He says, ‚Äúbecause it arises from that.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste skabs kyi spyi'o ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste skabs kyi spyi'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is non-existent,‚Äù refers to the other, the universal of the context.

original: / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis bzhin du brtags pa rnams tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis bzhin du brtags pa rnams tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The imagined are different from the two, perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúperception and inference.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ci ste ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci ste ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why is it not like that?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: de ste mthong ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ste mthong ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúI see it,‚Äù

original: rtags kyi dbye ba zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rtags kyi dbye ba zhes 'brel to //
translated: the division of the reason is connected.

original: rtags kyi dbye bsgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid yin pas yul gyi dbye bas ci bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtags kyi dbye bsgrub par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid yin pas yul gyi dbye bas ci bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the proof of the division of the reason is direct perception, the meaning is that the division of the object is useless.

original: de lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni //
translated: If that is so, there is an absurd consequence, he says:

original: 'o na rnam pa drug tu zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa can dang don gcig la 'du ba can dang 'gal ba @97a * //
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa drug tu zhes bya ba ste / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ldan pa can dang don gcig la 'du ba can dang 'gal ba @97a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, there are six,‚Äù

original: can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: which are: the reason that has a result, the reason that has a property of the subject, the reason that has a contradictory object, and the reason that has a pervasion.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù is the second objection.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa 'di la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù is in this second objection.

original: spyi ste rnam pa gsum kho na'o //
analyzed: spyi ste rnam pa gsum kho na'o //
translated: The general is only three kinds.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dngos dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe actual‚Äù and so on.

translated: The word ‚Äúthing‚Äù refers to a thing, such as a tree; the word ‚Äúnon-thing‚Äù refers to the absence of a thing, such as a pot; and the word ‚Äúboth‚Äù refers to the absence of both.

original: rang gi ngo bos yod pa'i phyir dang / du ba'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos yod pa'i phyir dang / du ba'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the thing, such as a tree, exists by its own nature, and the non-thing, such as the absence of a pot, does not exist by its own nature.

original: gang la rten de dag yod pa de'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang la rten de dag yod pa de'i dngos po ste /
translated: The thing that has those as its basis is the effect.üîΩThe reason is that the effect is inferred by way of that.üîΩIf the cognition is different from that which is its object, then the reason is different from the effect.

original: de'i sgo nas 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa'i phyir rang bzhin la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs tha dad pa yin no zhes 'brel to //

translated: If the cognition is not different from that which is its object, then the reason is not different from the effect.

original: gal te shes pa de gang gis nye bar len pa can yin pa de tha dad par 'gyur mod /üîΩrtags go ci ltar zhe na de byed pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //üîΩ'di nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //

translated: If the cognition is both different and not different from that which is its object, then the reason is contradictory.üîΩIf the cognition is neither different nor not different from that which is its object, then the reason is inconclusive.
