analyzed: de ni shes pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: It is just consciousness.

original: nyid kyi sgras ni spyi dmigs pa nyid yin pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgras ni spyi dmigs pa nyid yin pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The word just refutes that it is the apprehension of a universal.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression of that refers to that.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that conceives of a universal.

original: ci'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that there is no object?

original: spyi zhes smos te /
analyzed: spyi zhes smos te /
translated: The word universal is stated.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa ltar mtshan ma'i yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa ltar mtshan ma'i yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not an object that has a sign, like a principal and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The expression in this way clarifies this.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya yin no zhes brjod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid gcig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya yin no zhes brjod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid gcig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since only the particular is the object of valid knowledge, it is said to be the object of comprehension. The expression the particular alone is stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The expression because a universal is stated.

original: 'o na gang gzhal bya yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gzhal bya yin snyam na /
translated: Well then, what is the object of comprehension?

original: don dam par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam par zhes gsungs so //
translated: The expression ultimately is stated.

original: gal te dngos po la shes pa nyid 'jug pa yin na rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba mngon sum dang spyi'i mtshan nyid snang ba rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dngos po la shes pa nyid 'jug pa yin na rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba mngon sum dang spyi'i mtshan nyid snang ba rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: If cognition is applied to an entity, then perception is the appearance of a particular, and inference is the appearance of a universal.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩgzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
analyzed: de skad du yang / gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there are two objects of valid cognition, there are two valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: de na gcig kho nar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de na gcig kho nar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then how can there be only one?

original: de nyid yod pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid yod pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it exists as that.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na dpyad par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na dpyad par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In inference, only a particular is to be examined,

original: spyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni ma yin no //
translated: not a universal.üîΩFrom where?

original: de gang las zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu ba nas de las grub phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ste rang gi mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: de gang las zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu ba nas de las grub phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ste rang gi mtshan nyid las so //
translated: This is the response: ‚ÄúBecause it is established from that,‚Äù that is, from a particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na thun mong du mtshon pa na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na thun mong du mtshon pa na spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: When a particular is indicated as common, it is a universal.

original: de lta na yang snang ba tha dad pa'i sgo nas gzhal bya gnyis su 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang snang ba tha dad pa'i sgo nas gzhal bya gnyis su 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Even so, it is tenable that there are two objects of valid cognition from the perspective of different appearances.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rjes su dpag par yod pa dang med pa nyid du dpyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rjes su dpag par yod pa dang med pa nyid du dpyod pa yin te /
translated: It is the existence or nonexistence of the inference of intrinsic identity alone that is being analyzed.

original: rnam par dpyod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is the nature of analysis.

original: /'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: /'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not grasping.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa gtan la dbab pa'i don du tshad ma dpyod pa'i bstan bcos byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa dang med pa gtan la dbab pa'i don du tshad ma dpyod pa'i bstan bcos byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Those who are rationalists compose treatises that analyze valid cognitions in order to determine the existence and nonexistence of intrinsic identity.

original: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rang @99a * //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'o // gal te rang @99a * //
translated: The meaning is that they are things that perform functions.

original: gi mtshan nyid don du gnyer na 'o na tshad ma btsal bas ci snyam na /
analyzed: gi mtshan nyid don du gnyer na 'o na tshad ma btsal bas ci snyam na /
translated: If one seeks intrinsic identity, then what is the use of seeking valid cognitions?üîΩThe response is that ‚Äúone seeks valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: tshad ma tshol ba yang zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma tshol ba yang zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning is that one seeks intrinsic identity.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don du ma yin pa'o //
translated: If that were not so, that is, if one were not seeking to understand intrinsic identity,üîΩthen one would not seek valid cognitions.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don du tshad ma tshol ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don du tshad ma tshol ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one seeks a valid cognition for the sake of understanding its own characteristic.

original: don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i don dang bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a purpose‚Äù means being useful to people.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don du yin pa des na de don ston par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyi ga yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi brjod par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don du yin pa des na de don ston par byed pa'i tshad ma gnyi ga yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can gyi brjod par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the treatise is for the sake of its own characteristic, both valid cognitions that teach its purpose are said to have the own characteristic as their object.üîΩOtherwise, if the own characteristic were not the object,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid yul du bya ba ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid yul du bya ba ma yin na'o //
translated: then both would not have a purpose, and the treatise would not have a purpose.üîΩIf you say that both have a purpose, then what is the purpose of the treatise?

original: gal te gnyi gas kyang zhes bya ba nas she na zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gnyi gas kyang zhes bya ba nas she na zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: If you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of both, then what is the purpose of the two?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of the two, then what is the purpose of the two?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of the two, then what is the purpose of the two?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of the two, then what is the purpose of the two?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of the two, then what is the purpose of the two?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of the two, then what is the purpose of the two?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach the purpose of the two, then what is the purpose of the two?

original: rtsod pa smra ba nyid kyis 'on te yul gcig yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba nas gzhal bya don med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa smra ba nyid kyis 'on te yul gcig yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu ba nas gzhal bya don med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that the purpose of the two is to teach the purpose of the treatise, then what is the purpose of the treatise?üîΩIf you say that the purpose of the treatise is to teach

original: 'gal mod snyam na slob dpon gyis kyang gsungs so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'gal mod snyam na slob dpon gyis kyang gsungs so zhes 'brel to //
translated: If you think there is a contradiction, the connection is that the master also said that.

original: gzhung gang gis she na /
analyzed: gzhung gang gis she na /
translated: By what text?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of what.

original: gang gi phyir rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhal bya yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhal bya yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because the specific and general characteristics are objects of comprehension, therefore there are two valid cognitions.

original: slob dpon dang 'gal ba ni rung ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang 'gal ba ni rung ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not right to contradict the master.

original: ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang gtan tshigs 'di tshad ma'i dbye ba sgrub par mi nus so zhes bya ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang gtan tshigs 'di tshad ma'i dbye ba sgrub par mi nus so zhes bya ba brjod pa ni /
translated: Also, this reason is not able to establish the division of valid cognition because of being inconclusive. This is stated by

original: tshogs pa'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the phrase by the division of the collection.

original: 'on te gzhal bya gnyis yin pa las tshad ma tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: 'on te gzhal bya gnyis yin pa las tshad ma tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Or, if one suspects that it is different from the two valid cognitions because of being the object of comprehension,

original: de yang ma nges pa'i nyes pas nyes pa chags pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhal bya'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa'i nyes pas nyes pa chags pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhal bya'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then that also is faulty because of the fault of inconclusiveness. This is stated by by the division of the object of comprehension.

original: tshad ma mtha' yas par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma mtha' yas par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: it does not follow that there are an infinite number of valid cognitions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩtha dad gyang zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / tha dad gyang zhes bya ba ste //
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i yul gyi'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i yul gyi'o //
translated: The ‚Äúdifference‚Äù is that of the objects, such as form, taste, and so on.

original: gal te gcig yin pa'i phyir mngon sum thams cad gcig yin na /
analyzed: gal te gcig yin pa'i phyir mngon sum thams cad gcig yin na /
translated: If, because they are the same, all perceptions are the same,üîΩthen why is it that, even though the sense faculties and so on exist, they are not the same?

original: dbang po la sogs skyes pa nyid yod pa las kyang ci ste ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni tshogs pa tha dad pa yin na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs skyes pa nyid yod pa las kyang ci ste ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni tshogs pa tha dad pa yin na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this objection is as follows: ‚ÄúEven if the collections are different . . .‚Äù

original: @99b dbang po las skyes pa nyid ni mngon sum rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: @99b dbang po las skyes pa nyid ni mngon sum rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: The fact that something is produced from a sense faculty is not the reason that perception is different from inference,

original: de med kyang rig pa la sogs pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de med kyang rig pa la sogs pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: because even though that is not the case, such things as awareness are perceptions.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid ni yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid ni yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúif that is the case.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum thams cad tshad ma gcig kho na yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum thams cad tshad ma gcig kho na yin la /
translated: Because all perceptions are only one valid cognition,

original: sgra dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa las tshogs pa tha dad pas bskyed pa'i tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa las tshogs pa tha dad pas bskyed pa'i tshad ma yin te /
translated: and sound and contact, etc., are valid cognitions generated by a different collection of causes than inference.

original: don dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / grub na ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis yin pa nyid las zhes bya ba snang ba bzhin pa rnam pa gnyis yin pa nyid las so //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / grub na ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis yin pa nyid las zhes bya ba snang ba bzhin pa rnam pa gnyis yin pa nyid las so //
translated: Because the connection with the object is not established, and if it were established, it would be inference. Therefore, because there are two objects means because there are two aspects, like the appearance.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhal bya rnam pa gnyis yin pa'o //
translated: Otherwise means if there were not two objects.

original: des na ha cang khyab pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ha cang khyab pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore there is no fault of overpervasion, and so on.

original: gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not correct to say because there are two objects,üîΩbecause the nature of blue, etc., is limitless.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to the doubt is how?

original: mtha' yas pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is limitless.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: No is the response.

original: mtha' yas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not infinite.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sngon po la sogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúblue, etc.‚Äù

original: mtha' yas pa nyid yin na ji ltar rnam pa gnyis yin snyam na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa nyid yin na ji ltar rnam pa gnyis yin snyam na 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is infinite, how can it be twofold? Thus it is said, ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang gzhan pa'i tshad ma byed pa tha dad pa las rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu rnam pa gnyis su 'jog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum dang gzhan pa'i tshad ma byed pa tha dad pa las rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu rnam pa gnyis su 'jog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the single intrinsic identity is posited as twofold, from the difference in the operation of direct perception and other valid cognitions.

original: ji ltar zhes dogs pa bsu nas re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtha' yas pa yin yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes dogs pa bsu nas re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtha' yas pa yin yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating the doubt, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù in order to establish the intrinsic identity, it is said, ‚ÄúAlthough the divisions of blue, etc. are infinite.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni don dam par mi 'gyur la /üîΩgnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa yang gzhal bya gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni don dam par mi 'gyur la / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa yang gzhal bya gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Intrinsic identity is not ultimately real.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And if it were the intrinsic identity of both, it would follow that the object of comprehension would be different. Anticipating this, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said . . .‚Äù

original: dogs pa de zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa med cing gzhan zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: dogs pa de zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa med cing gzhan zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The doubter is the one who has not realized the intrinsic identity, and the other is the one who has realized the inference.

original: de ltar rtogs pa po gcig la ltos nas don dam pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa po gcig la ltos nas don dam pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having expressed the non-ultimate nature in dependence on a single cognizer,

original: rtogs pa po tha dad pa la ltos kyang brjod pa ni de bzhin du bya ba'o //üîΩgcig la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum @100a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa po tha dad pa la ltos kyang brjod pa ni de bzhin du bya ba'o // gcig la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum @100a * //
translated: the expression is to be applied in the same way in dependence on different cognizers.

original: mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la'o //
translated: As for one, it is in regard to the direct perceiver.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba rjes su dpog pa po la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba rjes su dpog pa po la'o //
translated: As for the other, it is in regard to the inferential cognizer.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, means if it were not so.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na rtogs pa po la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na rtogs pa po la zhes smos te /
translated: If you think that is so, it is said in regard to the cognizer.

original: dngos po rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Because the entity has a single intrinsic identity, is what is thought.

original: de ltar yang tha dad na ni rtags pa kho nar 'gyur zhes gsungs po'i ni ltos pas byas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang tha dad na ni rtags pa kho nar 'gyur zhes gsungs po'i ni ltos pas byas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said if it were different, it would be only an inference. By dependence is what is made.

original: de gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba rang spyi'i rang bzhin gyi'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i zhes bya ba rang spyi'i rang bzhin gyi'o //
translated: The two of them‚Äù refers to the specific and general natures.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the nature of the two.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba gsum pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba gsum pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äú In another‚Äù refers to the third, which will arise.

original: 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will occur.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: Because of that, when there is such an analysis,

original: de ni rang gzhan ngo bo yin //
analyzed: de ni rang gzhan ngo bo yin //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the nature of self and other.‚Äù

original: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'dod //
translated: ‚Äú Because of understanding, the objects of comprehension are asserted to be two.‚ÄùüîΩBecause of that, this is not tenable.

original: ces bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ces bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù and so on is not correct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa rang gi mtshan nyid de gzhal bya nyid de gzhal bya nyid yin na /
analyzed: don dam pa rang gi mtshan nyid de gzhal bya nyid de gzhal bya nyid yin na /
translated: If the ultimate is a specific characteristic, it is an object of comprehension.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i nang gi dbye bas gzhal bya nyid ni mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i nang gi dbye bas gzhal bya nyid ni mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is an object of comprehension, it would be an object of comprehension that is infinite in terms of internal divisions, such as blue and so on.

original: 'on te gcig nyid tshad ma'i byed pa tha dad pas tha dad pa yin na ni de ltar na tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ltos pas byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gcig nyid tshad ma'i byed pa tha dad pas tha dad pa yin na ni de ltar na tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni ltos pas byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if they are different because the function of valid cognition is different, then the characteristic of difference would be understood. This is called ‚Äúmade by dependence.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid min par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i zhes bya bas kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid min par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i zhes bya bas kha bskang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be a characteristic‚Äù should be completed with ‚Äúof difference.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: The proponent of tenets states the definition of ultimate:

original: dmigs pa yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy observation.‚Äù

original: gang zhig mngon sum gyis mtshon pa nyid dam pas yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum gyis mtshon pa nyid dam pas yin te /
translated: That which is indicated by direct perception is ultimate.

original: de las don bya ba 'thob pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas dmigs pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las don bya ba 'thob pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas dmigs pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Because an object‚Äôs function is obtained from that, it is not observed by inference,

original: de las don bya ba mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las don bya ba mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an object‚Äôs function is not obtained from that.

original: gal te dmigs pas don mtshon pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pas don mtshon pa yin na /
translated: If observation indicates an object,üîΩthen how is it that observation itself exists?üîΩThe ultimate is not observed,

original: 'o na ji ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes brjod snyam na don dam dmigs pa ni med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes brjod snyam na don dam dmigs pa ni med pa yin la /
translated: but it is not the case that it is not observed.

original: de las bzlog pas dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni dmigs pa nyin ni dngos po rnams kyi don dam pa'i yod pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag ste bzlog pas don dmigs pas ni med pa yin noüîΩzhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni dmigs pa nyin ni dngos po rnams kyi don dam pa'i yod pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag ste bzlog pas don dmigs pas ni med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe opposite of that is the object, not something else.‚Äù The object is posited as the ultimate existence of things. The opposite of that is nonexistence.

original: re zhig phyed snga ma sngar rnam par 'grel ba ni dngos po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig phyed snga ma sngar rnam par 'grel ba ni dngos po rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first half is explained first: ‚ÄúThings‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la @100b sogs pas phyed phyi ma 'phangs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la @100b sogs pas phyed phyi ma 'phangs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on indicate the second half.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa zhes bya bas 'chad pa'o //üîΩgal te med na mi dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa zhes bya bas 'chad pa'o // gal te med na mi dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe horns of a rabbit‚Äù and so on explain it.üîΩIf it does not exist, it is not observed.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: But nonobservation itself does not mean it does not exist.üîΩTherefore, ‚ÄúThe object of the opposite is existence.‚ÄùüîΩWhy is it said?üîΩThe anticipation is, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist, it is not observed.üîΩBut nonobservation itself does not mean it does not exist.

original: des na / bzlog pa las 'das dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: des na / bzlog pa las 'das dmigs pa ni //
translated: Therefore, ‚ÄòThe object of the opposite is existence.‚ÄôüîΩWhy is it said?‚Äù

original: yod pa yin no zhes ci ste brjod ces dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te de la yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩri bong gi rva la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: yod pa yin no zhes ci ste brjod ces dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te de la yang zhes bya ba ste /üîΩri bong gi rva la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The anticipation is, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist, it is not observed.üîΩBut nonobservation itself does not mean it does not exist.üîΩTherefore, ‚ÄòThe object of the opposite is existence.‚ÄôüîΩWhy is it said?‚Äù

original: ma dmigs pa las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-apprehension‚Äù is the answer.

original: med pa ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan kho na'o zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ma dmigs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa ni mi dmigs pa las gzhan kho na'o zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ma dmigs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-apprehension‚Äù is not something different from ‚Äúnon-existence.‚Äù

original: ci zhig ces bya ba'i dri ba sngon du btang ba can mi dmigs pa nyid rnam pa gsum du rnam par rtog pa ni dmigs pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba'i dri ba sngon du btang ba can mi dmigs pa nyid rnam pa gsum du rnam par rtog pa ni dmigs pa med pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The question ‚ÄúWhat?‚Äù is followed by the three kinds of non-apprehension: ‚ÄúIs it the non-apprehension of the object?‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dngos po sel ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dngos po sel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the exclusion of the thing.

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas drangs la /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas drangs la /
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù is drawn from within.

original: de las ci ltar zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de las ci ltar zhes sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that, how?‚Äù is added.

original: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa de las so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dmigs pa de las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù is the object of the characteristic of the negation.üîΩThe question ‚ÄúWhy is it not understood?‚Äù is drawn from within.

original: ci'i phyir mi rtogs snyam du dogs pa bsu ba nas ji ltar dmigs par bya ba med par ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du dmigs pa med pa yang dmigs pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rtogs snyam du dogs pa bsu ba nas ji ltar dmigs par bya ba med par ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du dmigs pa med pa yang dmigs pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the object of apprehension does not exist without the object of apprehension, in the same way, non-apprehension is not the apprehension.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence‚Äù is the thing.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa ni 'ga' zhig rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa ni 'ga' zhig rtogs pa'am /
translated: Thus, non-entity is not the realization of anything,

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par yin no //
translated: nor is it the cause of realization.

original: de yang ji ltar rtogs zhes bstan pa'i don du dngos po med pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rtogs zhes bstan pa'i don du dngos po med pa yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, non-entity is also not the object of realization.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa dngos po med pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa dngos po med pa de yang ngo //
translated: That non-entity is also not the object of realization.

original: gal te don bzhin du shes pa la ni dmigs pa gzhan med pa de na de med pas dmigs pa med pa rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar thug pa med par 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te don bzhin du shes pa la ni dmigs pa gzhan med pa de na de med pas dmigs pa med pa rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar thug pa med par 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If consciousness is like the object, and there is no other object, then since that does not exist, the non-existent object is not to be realized. How could there be an infinite regress?

original: dmigs pa las ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa las ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the object‚Äù means from the formless.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù means by the non-existent object.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the non-existent object.

original: gal te shes pa la dmigs pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa la dmigs pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: If it is asked how it is known that there is no other object for consciousness,

original: shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes smras so //
analyzed: shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes smras so //
translated: because consciousness is hidden.

original: gal te shes pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te shes pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: If it is said that the so-called consciousness is the reply,

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: the so-called is the consciousness without an aspect.

original: yod par ma rtogs na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: yod par ma rtogs na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that there is no fault in not understanding existence,

original: ji ltar don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, how is it the object?

original: mi dmigs pa las bya @101a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las bya @101a * //
translated: The activity from non-apprehension

original: pa ni tshad ma la log pa'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: pa ni tshad ma la log pa'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: is from the nature of the five valid cognitions being reversed.

original: gal te blo ni tshad ma lnga log par ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te blo ni tshad ma lnga log par ma grub ste /
translated: If it is doubted that the mind is not established as the reversal of the five valid cognitions

original: don gyi sgo bar yod pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: don gyi sgo bar yod pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: because of the existence of the door of the object,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, but if.

original: de la ni snang bzhin pa'i don las tha dad pa'i blo la'o //
analyzed: de la ni snang bzhin pa'i don las tha dad pa'i blo la'o //
translated: There, the mind that is different from the appearing object.

original: des na zhes bya ba don gyis go bar yod pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba don gyis go bar yod pas so //
translated: Therefore, because of the existence of the understood object,

original: de lta na don gyis go ba'i blo med par 'gyur te tshad ma lnga med pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni don gyis go ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na don gyis go ba'i blo med par 'gyur te tshad ma lnga med pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni don gyis go ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in that case, the mind that is understood would be non-existent because of the non-existence of the five valid cognitions. The reply is, the understood object also.

original: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ni dang po la'o //
analyzed: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ni dang po la'o //
translated: If it is said, but if, it is in the first.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe realization of the object to be comprehended‚Äù means

original: don gyis go ba'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa gang zhig grub pa'i don du don gyis go bar 'gyur ba'i shes pa de ni gzhal bya yin la /
analyzed: don gyis go ba'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa gang zhig grub pa'i don du don gyis go bar 'gyur ba'i shes pa de ni gzhal bya yin la /
translated: that the object to be comprehended is the cognition that is the nature of the understanding of the object, which is established for the sake of the understanding of the object.

original: de rtogs pa ni gal te gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni gal te gsal ba'o //
translated: The realization of that is clear.

original: yang don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni de ltar don gyis go ba'i blo gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhan dang gzhan bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: yang don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni de ltar don gyis go ba'i blo gzhan dang gzhan gyis gzhan dang gzhan bsgrub par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the understanding of the object‚Äù means that the understanding of the object is established by one understanding of the object after another.

original: thug pa med pa'i phyir na gang du nye bar mi gnas pa de kho nar med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i phyir na gang du nye bar mi gnas pa de kho nar med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is an infinite regress, it is not the case that there is no understanding of the object at all.

original: 'on te mthar gyis pa'i don gyis go bar ni de gzhan la mi ltos te /
analyzed: 'on te mthar gyis pa'i don gyis go bar ni de gzhan la mi ltos te /
translated: But if the understanding of the object is sequential, then the understanding of the object does not depend on another.

original: mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is seen.

original: gal te zhes bya bas na ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i bar ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya bas na ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i bar ni lan no //
translated: The response to this objection is as follows: If you say that the understanding of the object is sequential, then what is the use of the understanding of the object?üîΩThe response to this is as follows: What is the use of the understanding of the object?

original: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The objection is as follows: Because of the understanding of the object.

original: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù is the response.

original: de'i phyir shes pa lkog tu gyur par zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa lkog tu gyur par zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is untenable to say, ‚ÄúThe cognition is hidden.‚Äù

original: gal te rigs pa rnams ni ci ltar shes pa gzhan gyis mngon sum du byed pa yin na de'i tshe de med kyang dmigs pa med pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na ;
analyzed: gal te rigs pa rnams ni ci ltar shes pa gzhan gyis mngon sum du byed pa yin na de'i tshe de med kyang dmigs pa med pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na ;
translated: If the reasonings are like that, then when another cognition makes something manifest, at that time, even though that does not exist, it is realized by another nonapprehending cognition.

original: thug pa med pa nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: thug pa med pa nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fault of infinite regress remains.

original: rang rig pa'i phyogs la yang de bzlog tu med pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i phyogs la yang de bzlog tu med pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Also, in the context of reflexive awareness, it cannot be averted.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù is the question.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i blo bzhin med par rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i blo bzhin med par rtogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the realization of nonexistence, which is not like a manifest cognition.

original: ji ltar don med pa dmigs pa med pa gzhan gyis rtogs pa de bzhin du de med pa yang gzhan gyis yin la de yang gzhan gyis yin pa'i thug pa med do //
analyzed: ji ltar don med pa dmigs pa med pa gzhan gyis rtogs pa de bzhin du de med pa yang gzhan gyis yin la de yang gzhan gyis yin pa'i thug pa med do //
translated: Just as the nonexistence of an object is realized by another nonapprehending cognition, in the same way, the nonexistence of that is by another, and that is by another, and so on, so there is an infinite regress.

original: 'on te yang shes pa bzhin du de med par yang rang nyid las 'grub pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te yang shes pa bzhin du de med par yang rang nyid las 'grub pa des na /
translated: But if, like consciousness, it is established from itself even when it does not exist,

original: thug pa med pa ma yin na de lta na don med pa yang rang las 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thug pa med pa ma yin na de lta na don med pa yang rang las 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: then there is no infinite regress. In that case, non-objects would also be established from themselves,

original: ngo bo med par khyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med par khyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between them in that they are both non-entities.üîΩTherefore, non-apprehension is meaningless.

original: @101b des na mi dmigs don med do //üîΩdes na don med pa bzhin du //
analyzed: @101b des na mi dmigs don med do // des na don med pa bzhin du //
translated: Therefore,

original: shes pa med pa yang rang las 'grub pa ma yin pas na thug pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa med pa yang rang las 'grub pa ma yin pas na thug pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: just as non-objects are not established from themselves, consciousness also is not established from itself. Thus there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te don dang dmigs pa dag gi mi dmigs pa gcig yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te don dang dmigs pa dag gi mi dmigs pa gcig yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: If the non-apprehension of objects and the apprehension of non-objects are the same,

original: de med par rtogs pa la thug pa med pas ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med par rtogs pa la thug pa med pas ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there is no infinite regress in the realization of their non-existence. Thus it is not the case that they are not established.üîΩTo anticipate this objection, he says, ‚ÄúBut if . . . ‚Äù

original: de dag gi mi dmigs pa gcig yin na yang /
analyzed: de dag gi mi dmigs pa gcig yin na yang /
translated: Even if the non-apprehension of those two is the same,

original: ji ltar don yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du dmigs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar don yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du dmigs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: just as objects exist, so too the apprehension of non-objects would exist.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To answer this, he says, ‚ÄúIf that were so . . . ‚Äù

original: ma grub pa nyid kyi nyes pas btang snyoms su byas te /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid kyi nyes pas btang snyoms su byas te /
translated: The fault of nonestablishment is disregarded,

original: ma nges pa nyid brjod par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid brjod par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: and the fault of inconclusiveness is stated.

original: des na dngos po med pa tha dad par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na /
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa tha dad par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na /
translated: Therefore, according to those who advocate the difference of nonentity,

original: ma dmigs pa las ni don dang dmigs pa dag las gcig kyang med pa mi grub po zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa las ni don dang dmigs pa dag las gcig kyang med pa mi grub po zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: it is intended that nonexistence is not established from nonapprehension either of the object or of the apprehension.

original: ma nges pa nyid spong pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid spong pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni ;
translated: Anticipating the objection that the fault of inconclusiveness is still not avoided,

original: de nyid med pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ste don rang dmigs pa dag gis dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid med pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ste don rang dmigs pa dag gis dmigs pa nyid med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that it is the nonexistence of that itself. ‚Äù If it is said that the nonexistence of the apprehension is due to the nonapprehension of the object and the apprehension,üîΩthen it is replied that the entity and the apprehension would be established as the nature of that.üîΩIf it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the nonexistence of the apprehension is due to the nonapprehension of the object,üîΩthen the entity and the apprehension would be established as the nature of that. ‚ÄùüîΩIf it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the nonexistence of the apprehension is due to the nonapprehension of the object,

original: de lta na dngos po dang dmigs pa dag kyang de'i bdag nyid du grub par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po dang dmigs pa dag kyang de'i bdag nyid du grub par 'gyur ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: then the entity and the apprehension would be established as the nature of that. ‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩshes pa gcig la bde ba dmigs pas kyang de las gzhan dmigs pa med par nges par byed pa yin te ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩshes pa gcig la bde ba dmigs pas kyang de las gzhan dmigs pa med par nges par byed pa yin te ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the nonexistence of the apprehension is due to the nonapprehension of the object,üîΩthen the entity and the apprehension would be established as the nature of that. ‚ÄùüîΩIf it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the nonexistence of the apprehension is due to the nonapprehension of the object,üîΩthen the entity and the apprehension would be established as the nature of that. ‚ÄùüîΩIf it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the nonexistence of the apprehension is due to the nonapprehension of the object,üîΩthen the entity and the apprehension would be established as the nature of that. ‚Äù

original: des na brjod ma thag pa'i nyes pa'i rnam pa dag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /

analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes ming btags pa'o //

analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /

original: dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa brjod pa'o //üîΩrang gi rig pa gzhan gyis dben pa las dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa gzhan ni ma grub ste /
