translated: we reply, ‚ÄúThen it is not tenable that it is not perceived.‚ÄùüîΩIf you

original: des na thug pa med pa kho na'o zhes lan 'debs pa ni med pa'i mtshan nyid can te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na thug pa med pa kho na'o zhes lan 'debs pa ni med pa'i mtshan nyid can te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the reply that it is only an infinite regress is characterized by nonexistence.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba 'gags kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba 'gags kyang ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is stopped, by what?

original: dmigs pa med par de nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni thug pa med pa de nyid zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par de nyid yin no zhes brjod pa ni thug pa med pa de nyid zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is that very thing without an object. The infinite regress is that very thing.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa spong bar dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa spong bar dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: Individually means that the objection is anticipated that it is not established.

original: so sor nges pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa'i phyir de mi dmigs par nges pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa'i phyir de mi dmigs par nges pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Because of the apprehension of the individual forms, it is ascertained that it is not apprehended.

original: ci 'di zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ci 'di zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: What is this? The reply.

original: nges pa'i rnam par dmigs pa gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa ni dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam par dmigs pa gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa ni dmigs pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the apprehension is not tenable in another way. This is the proof of the apprehension.

original: de lta'o zhes na zhes bya ba ni gal te don gyis go ba khas len na de'i thugs pa med do //
analyzed: de lta'o zhes na zhes bya ba ni gal te don gyis go ba khas len na de'i thugs pa med do //
translated: If it is so, if one accepts the understanding by the meaning, then there is no problem.

original: 'di ltar don gyis go ba ni blo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don gyis go ba ni blo yin no //
translated: In this way, the understanding by the meaning is the mind.

original: de yang lkog tu gyur pa des na don gyis go ba gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang lkog tu gyur pa des na don gyis go ba gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is hidden, it is to be understood by implication by others.

original: de yang de las gzhan gyi yin no zhes brjod pa ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang de las gzhan gyi yin no zhes brjod pa ni bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been explained that it belongs to something other than that.

original: 'on te nges pa'i rnam par dmigs pa las ni med par 'grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa'i rnam par dmigs pa las ni med par 'grub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not the case that nonexistence is established from the nonapprehension of a determined form.

original: 'on kyang rig par byas par ni mi dmigs pa de nyid yin gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rig par byas par ni mi dmigs pa de nyid yin gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Rather, that very nonapprehension is what is understood, not the nonexistence of the thing.

original: des na thug pa med pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni so sor nges pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na thug pa med pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni so sor nges pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no infinite regress.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: If that is so, then, this is the response:

original: gal te dngos po ni rang dang gzhan la ltos nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin yang dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes ji ltar @102b tha snyad byed snyam na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po ni rang dang gzhan la ltos nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin yang dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes ji ltar @102b tha snyad byed snyam na /
translated: If a thing, in dependence on itself and another, has the nature of both a thing and a nonthing, how can you say that existence is just apprehension?

original: so sor nges pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is determined.‚ÄùüîΩIf a thing, in dependence on itself and another, has the nature of both a thing and a nonthing, how can you say that existence is just apprehension?

original: de yang dmigs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object is the nature of that.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúindividually.‚Äù

original: gal te so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin ni gzhal bya ma yin nam des na de dmigs par ni gzhan kho na yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin ni gzhal bya ma yin nam des na de dmigs par ni gzhan kho na yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: If the nature of individual determination is not an object of knowledge, then since it is something else that is the object,

original: ci ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: how can the object exist?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is the object.

original: las ni gal te dmigs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: las ni gal te dmigs par bya ba'o //
translated: The action is ‚Äúif it is to be perceived.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar so sor nges pa'i blor 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar so sor nges pa'i blor 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how can there be an individually determining cognition?

original: dmigs pa dran pa nyid las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dran pa nyid las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúfrom the memory of the object.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa med par ni so sor nges pa'i blor mi 'gyur ba des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa med par ni so sor nges pa'i blor mi 'gyur ba des na'o //
translated: Because without an object there would not be an individually determining cognition.

original: phyogs gnyis pa bsal bas gsum pa la brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa bsal bas gsum pa la brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The third is stated in order to eliminate the second position. ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù is stated.

original: dpyad zin to zhes bya ba ni med pa dang ma yin pa'i phyir dbye bas phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyad zin to zhes bya ba ni med pa dang ma yin pa'i phyir dbye bas phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready examined‚Äù means that the fault has been stated in both positions, because of non-existence and because of the division into non-being.

original: de ltar dmigs pa nyid don dam par yin pa yin pa yin no zhes bya ba bshad nas gal te rtogs pa'i dbye bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa spang ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa nyid don dam par yin pa yin pa yin no zhes bya ba bshad nas gal te rtogs pa'i dbye bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa spang ba'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, having explained that the object itself is ultimate, in order to eliminate the objection beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is a division of cognition,‚Äù he anticipates the doubt:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is that itself,‚Äù

original: de nyid ni dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: that itself is the object.

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpog pa po'i skyes bu'i gzhan la ltos /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpog pa po'i skyes bu'i gzhan la ltos /
translated: At that time, the person who infers depends on another.

original: skyes bu'i gzhan la ltos nas kyang dmigs par byed pa de ni de lta bu kho na zhes bya ba dmigs par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i gzhan la ltos nas kyang dmigs par byed pa de ni de lta bu kho na zhes bya ba dmigs par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: And depending on another person, the object is inferred.üîΩHe anticipates the doubt:

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of being hidden,‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshe ni rjes su dpog pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe ni rjes su dpog pa'i dus na'o //
translated: at that time, the time of inference,

original: de ni dmigs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dmigs par bya ba'o //
translated: that is the object.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that very fact‚Äù is the reply.

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf the object of apprehension‚Äù

original: dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The nature of the object of apprehension is to be inferred.

original: 'on kyang mi nye ba las mngon sum du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi nye ba las mngon sum du snang ba yin no //
translated: But it is not perceived when it is not near.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te 'gas kyang zhes bya ba ste rang ngam gzhan 'gas kyang ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'gas kyang zhes bya ba ste rang ngam gzhan 'gas kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not apprehended by anyone‚Äù means by itself or by another.

original: dmigs par bya ba yang yin pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni mi slu ba med pa'i phyir na tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba yang yin pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni mi slu ba med pa'i phyir na tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The inference that has an object of apprehension as its domain is not valid knowledge because it is not nondeceptive.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus su dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin du ma rtogs par dmigs par bya ba yin no zhes ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus su dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin du ma rtogs par dmigs par bya ba yin no zhes ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it is said that it is not reasonable to say that the object of apprehension is not realized as the nature of the object of apprehension at the time of inference, then the reply is:

original: de'i tshe ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i tshe de de ltar @103a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o // de'i tshe de de ltar @103a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, it is not realized.‚Äù

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, it is not like that‚Äù is the reply.

original: de lta ma yin pa ni dmigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ni dmigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not so, that is, it is not an object.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dogs pa de /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni dogs pa de /
translated: An object is a doubt.

original: rang gi rang bzhin du dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin du dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of one's own nature.

original: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not so, that is, it is not an object of perception.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Now, that is, the reply.

original: ma dmigs pa ni ma nges pas dngos po med par bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa ni ma nges pas dngos po med par bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since non-perception is indefinite, it does not establish non-existence, anticipating this doubt, Even if it exists, is said.

original: yod pa las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: yod pa las zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: From existence, that is, the reply.

original: ma dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul yod pa las tshad ma yod pa ste srid pa yin na /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi yul yod pa las tshad ma yod pa ste srid pa yin na /
translated: If valid cognition exists from the existence of the object of non-perception, then it is possible.

original: dngos po yod kyang ma dmigs so zhes de skad brjod par bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po yod kyang ma dmigs so zhes de skad brjod par bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if the thing exists, one should say, I do not perceive it.

original: gang gi tshe ma dmigs pa nyid tshad mas yul du ma byas pa'i phyir na mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin la tshad ma mi srid pa de'i tshe ji ltar yod pa la yang mi dmigs pa srid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma dmigs pa nyid tshad mas yul du ma byas pa'i phyir na mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin la tshad ma mi srid pa de'i tshe ji ltar yod pa la yang mi dmigs pa srid do zhes brjod do //
translated: When non-apprehension itself is not an object of a valid cognition, then non-apprehension cannot be a valid cognition. How can you say that something existent can be non-apprehended?

original: sha za ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i yu nyid du srid pa la yang yod kyang ma dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sha za ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i yu nyid du srid pa la yang yod kyang ma dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even if it is possible that something like a flesh-eater is a valid object, it is still non-apprehended.

original: 'on te ma dmigs pa'i rang bzhin la rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te ma dmigs pa'i rang bzhin la rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: But if you think that there is an inference in the nature of non-apprehension,

original: des na yod kyang ma dmigs so zhes brjod do zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: des na yod kyang ma dmigs so zhes brjod do zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: and that therefore you can say that something existent is non-apprehended,üîΩwe reply:

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Inference is not a valid cognition in regard to the imperceptible.

original: de yang zhes bya ba lan te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba lan te /
translated: And:üîΩInference is not a valid cognition in regard to the imperceptible.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin la ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference is called ‚Äúseen‚Äù because it follows the nature of what is seen. It is not a valid cognition in regard to the imperceptible.

original: des na ma dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ma dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of non-apprehension is simply non-existence.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus na don la blta bar bya ba nyid med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus na don la blta bar bya ba nyid med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If, at the time of inference, the object of vision does not exist,

original: des na mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ngo zhes bya ba ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be said that the nature of vision is followed?

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni phyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni phyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Anticipating this, he says, ‚ÄúLater on,‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus na'o //
translated: at the time of seeing.

original: sngar rjes su dpog pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sngar rjes su dpog pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBefore‚Äù is at the time of inference.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'i lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'i lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the response.

original: de'i tshe yod pa nyid ji ltar yin te blta bar bya ba ma yin pa ni yod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa nyid ji ltar yin te blta bar bya ba ma yin pa ni yod pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How can it exist at that time, since it is not the object of vision?

original: rtogs pa bsu ba ni phyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa bsu ba ni phyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Anticipating this, he says, ‚ÄúLater on,‚Äù

original: mi slu ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i dus na'o //
translated: at the time of nondeception.

original: phyis nyid ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: phyis nyid ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúLater on‚Äù is the response.

original: sngar ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sngar ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBefore‚Äù is at the time of inference.

original: phyis dmigs par bya ba nyid gzhan du mi 'thad pas sngar yod pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te sngar med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyis dmigs par bya ba nyid gzhan du mi 'thad pas sngar yod pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te sngar med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that the object of vision is different later on, it exists before.

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba lan no //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba lan no //
translated: The reply is: ‚Äúbecause of being the object of perception.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i @103b phyir na phyis kho na yod pa yin gyi sngar ma yin no //üîΩgal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus su de ltar rtogs pa ni blta bar bya ba ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te zhes dogs pa bsu pa ni dmigs par bya ba'i nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i @103b phyir na phyis kho na yod pa yin gyi sngar ma yin no // gal te rjes su dpag pa'i dus su de ltar rtogs pa ni blta bar bya ba ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te zhes dogs pa bsu pa ni dmigs par bya ba'i nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the object of perception, it exists only later, not earlier.üîΩIf it is thought that the object of perception is not perceived at the time of inference, then the reply is: ‚Äúbecause of being the object of perception.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ni rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ni rjes su 'jug go //
translated: If it were not so, then the object of perception would not be perceived.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not as the object of perception.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAt another time‚Äù means

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus yang ngo //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus yang ngo //
translated: at the time of inference.

original: de'i rang bzhin du ni dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin du'o //üîΩgzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba yin par ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ni dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin du'o // gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba yin par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn its nature‚Äù means in the nature of the object of perception.üîΩ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means as the object of perception.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not as the object of perception.

original: de ltar re zhig rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang yod pa nyid ni dmigs par bya ba med pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rjes su dpag pa'i dus su yang yod pa nyid ni dmigs par bya ba med pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, it has been shown that even at the time of inference, existence is not an object of perception.

original: nga ni rjes su dpag pa'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can gyi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: nga ni rjes su dpag pa'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can gyi tshad ma yin te /
translated: I am the valid cognition that is the future object of inference.

original: des na de'i yul du song ba las de'i yul dmigs par bya ba nyid bzlog tu med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na de'i yul du song ba las de'i yul dmigs par bya ba nyid bzlog tu med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since it is the object of that, it is not denied that its object is perceived.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said in the line ‚ÄúInference is . . .‚Äù

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yod pa la zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i shes pa'i yul la yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yod pa la zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i shes pa'i yul la yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of the future object‚Äù is the object of the cognition that will occur.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i ma dmigs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i ma dmigs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the non-perception of that which exists at the time of inference.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa nyams su ma myong yang yod par rtogs pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa nyams su ma myong yang yod par rtogs pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: For this very reason, it is not tenable that one understands existence even though one does not experience existence at the time of inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa las yul du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las yul du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is not taken as an object by inference.

original: gal te gnyi ga yang dmigs par bya ba kho na'i yul can yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga yang dmigs par bya ba kho na'i yul can yin na /
translated: If both are only objects of perception,

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How then?

original: gzhal bya gnyis med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of knowledge is nondual.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThat itself.‚Äù

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning is: the object of knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba'i ngo bos sam shes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba'i ngo bos sam shes pa'i rnam pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: By the nature of another, by the nature of what was seen before, or by the nature of the aspect of cognition.

original: dpe dang zhes bya ba ni de nyid gsal bar byed ba'o //
analyzed: dpe dang zhes bya ba ni de nyid gsal bar byed ba'o //
translated: The example is: ‚Äújust as,‚Äù which clarifies that.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means that the object of knowledge exists.

original: ji ltar gcig nyid du mar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig nyid du mar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How can one be many?

original: de nyid ces smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces smos te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThat itself.‚Äù

original: dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The meaning is: the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: de'i zhes bya ba dpe la mthong ba'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba dpe la mthong ba'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the example, because the nature of what was seen is superimposed.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltos pas byas ba tha dad na don dam mtshan nyid min par 'gyur zhes brjod pa'i rtsod pa rjes su brjod pas bden te zhes bya bas lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ltos pas byas ba tha dad na don dam mtshan nyid min par 'gyur zhes brjod pa'i rtsod pa rjes su brjod pas bden te zhes bya bas lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then Well then, and so forth, is a subsequent expression of the dispute, if they are different because of being made by reliance, then the ultimate would not be a characteristic. That is true, and so forth, is the reply.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes tha snyad 'dogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes tha snyad 'dogs snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, Well then, how is it conventionally designated?

original: @104a * // dngos po la mi slu ba'i sgo nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @104a * // dngos po la mi slu ba'i sgo nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, in terms of being undeceiving with regard to things.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba tha dad pa nyid du gang gis ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba tha dad pa nyid du gang gis ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is not realized that the appearance and the object of investigation are different.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu des na snang ba dang / rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don gcig tu byed par dngos po nyid yin pa de la ltos nas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu des na snang ba dang / rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don gcig tu byed par dngos po nyid yin pa de la ltos nas so //
translated: Because of that reason for making such a convention, the appearance and the object of investigation are made into one thing, in dependence on that, it is a thing.

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcig nyid mtshan nyid dang gzhan yin na ni de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi gzhal bya gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcig nyid mtshan nyid dang gzhan yin na ni de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi gzhal bya gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i /
translated: Or, if it is said, because it has the nature of both, then if the characteristic is different from the object of knowledge, it is an object of knowledge that has the nature of both.

original: rtsod pa brjod pa nas de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs par byed do //
analyzed: rtsod pa brjod pa nas de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba la sogs par byed do //
translated: From the statement of the dispute, that is not correct, and so on, he says, because it is not tenable that the object of knowledge is different from the characteristic.

original: rtogs par khas len na yang nyes pa yod do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs par khas len na yang nyes pa yod do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Even if one accepts that it is understood, he says, there is a fault,

original: rtogs yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te gzhal bya 'chol na tshad ma gnyis su ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: rtogs yang zhes bya ba'o // gal te gzhal bya 'chol na tshad ma gnyis su ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: saying even if it is understood.

original: rtogs pa'i dbye ba nyid kyis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbye ba nyid kyis zhes gsungs te /
translated: If the object of knowledge is mixed, how can there be two valid cognitions? He says, by the division of understanding.

original: gzhal byar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal byar bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the difference in the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pas nye bar zin pa'i rang bzhin ni mi gsal ba yin te /üîΩde na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas nye bar zin pa'i rang bzhin ni mi gsal ba yin te / de na gnyi ga'i rang bzhin nyid med pa'i phyir na /
translated: The nature that is grasped by inference is unclear,üîΩbecause there is no nature of both there.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang 'chol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang 'chol ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not mixed with the characteristic of an entity.

original: 'di yang rnam pa ji zhig ltar gcig nyid gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pas khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi de ni don dam par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa ji zhig ltar gcig nyid gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pas khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi de ni don dam par ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also said by accepting that in some way it is the nature of both, but that is not ultimately reasonable.

original: ltos pa byas pa yin pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltos pa byas pa yin pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is a dependent action‚Äù is the alternative.

original: gcig gi mtshan nyid gang zhig gsal ba tha dad pa mi gsal ba nyid kyis rtogs pa tha dad pa'i las yin pa de ni don dam pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gcig gi mtshan nyid gang zhig gsal ba tha dad pa mi gsal ba nyid kyis rtogs pa tha dad pa'i las yin pa de ni don dam pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The characteristic of one thing is not ultimately the action of a different manifestation due to the difference in manifestation.

original: des na gcig la mtshan nyid gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig la mtshan nyid gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one thing does not have two characteristics.

original: gal te gcig la yang ltos pas tha dad par mthong ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gcig la yang ltos pas tha dad par mthong ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it seen that even one thing is different due to dependence?‚Äù

original: des na ji ltar gcig gi rang bzhin dgag pa tsam yin snyam na /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar gcig gi rang bzhin dgag pa tsam yin snyam na / sngon po la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, how is it that the nature of one is merely negated?üîΩThe statement ‚Äúblue and so on‚Äù is the response.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sngon po nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to blue and so on.

original: tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not different‚Äù means that it has many aspects.

original: de'i phyir gang gis tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba gcig la ni rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis tshad ma gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ba gcig la ni rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not the case that one thing has two natures, how could there be a consequence of another valid cognition?

original: gal te gzhal bya'i dbye ba don dam pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya'i dbye ba don dam pa ma yin na /
translated: If the classification of objects of valid cognition is not ultimate,

original: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then how is it?

original: tshad ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs a valid cognition‚Äù is an inference.

original: gzhal bya'i dbye ba de nyid brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir don dam pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhal bya'i dbye ba de nyid brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir don dam pa yin gyi /
translated: Since that very classification of objects of valid cognition is a nature that is imagined, it is ultimate.

original: dngos po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ma yin te /
translated: But it is not an entity.

original: mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rang @104b bzhin thob pa gang zhig pa de ni don dam pa las gzhan min te /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rang @104b bzhin thob pa gang zhig pa de ni don dam pa las gzhan min te /
translated: Since it is not different from the ultimate, like a direct perception, what is obtained as the nature of an entity by inference is not different from the ultimate.

original: des na mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma kho na'o zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma kho na'o zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, like a direct perception, an inference is also only a valid cognition.

original: gzhan gyis yul gcig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yul gcig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it is said that the object is not different for direct perception and inference,

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ste rjes su dpag pa mngon sum las tha dad pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ste rjes su dpag pa mngon sum las tha dad pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it would follow that inference would not be different from direct perception.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /üîΩrang gi ngo bo dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni / rang gi ngo bo dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He clarifies that:üîΩ‚ÄúThe object is not different in nature.‚Äù

original: 'on te gal te rang gi ngo bos yul du byed pa ma yin gyi 'on te /
analyzed: 'on te gal te rang gi ngo bos yul du byed pa ma yin gyi 'on te /
translated: If it is said that the object is not different in nature,

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi ngo bos yin na ji ltar de rtogs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi ngo bos yin na ji ltar de rtogs te /
translated: then how is it that the object is known?
